# Careers - Job Openings in Chicago

## **We Are Hiring!**

The Heiser Group has been providing families and individuals with dependable, flexible and supportive jobs for over 44 years. As a Heiser Group employee, you will find our values of honesty, integrity, quality and service are essential in how we treat our employees. We prioritize flexible schedules and appropriately paid positions for all of our staff members. Our full-service janitorial company cleans residential, commercial and realty buildings around Lake County Illinois and beyond! 

We are looking for individuals who are trustworthy employees, take pride in providing an excellent cleaning service and cooperate well with others. Working for The Heiser Group offers paid training shifts, overtime pay for full-time staff, paid vacations and an opportunity for raises based on quality work. 

All of our employees are expected to show up on time with reliable transportation and excited to do a great job. You are required to clean designated and desired areas of the client’s space. After each cleaning, you are responsible for collecting your belongings and locking up the building.

**Job openings include:**

*   Janitor Positions
*   Day Porter Positions
*   Residential Cleaning Crew
*   Commercial Cleaning Crew
*   Realty Cleaning Crew
*   Specialty Cleaning Crew

## **Part-Time Janitor Position**

Requires traveling to different places within the Lake County area. Sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, dusting, sanitizing, removing trash and spot-cleaning glass are some of the tasks required.

**Schedule:** Flexible Hours / 10-20 hours per week

**Benefits:** Paid Training & Paid Vacation

**Pay:** Starts at $13/hr

## **Full-Time Janitor Position**

Requires traveling to different places within the Lake County area. Sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, dusting, sanitizing, removing trash and spot-cleaning glass are some of the tasks required.

**Schedule:** Work Daily / 30-40 hours per week 

**Benefits:** Overtime Pay, Opportunity for Raise & Paid Vacation

**Pay:** Starts at $13/hr

## **Day Porter Position**

Requires traveling to different places within the Lake County area. Sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, dusting, sanitizing, removing trash and spot-cleaning glass are some of the tasks required.

**Schedule:** Day Shift / 9AM - 2 PM 

**Benefits:** Paid Training & Paid Vacation

**Pay:** Starts at $15/hr

## **Residential Cleaning Crew**

Requires traveling to different homes within the Lake County area. Must bring provided supplies to clean designated areas. Sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, dusting, sanitizing, removing trash and spot-cleaning glass are some of the tasks required.

**Schedule:** Flexible Hours / 15-25 hours per week

**Benefits:** Paid Training & Paid Vacation

**Pay:** Starts at $18/hr

text:
Residential Cleaning
You have a busy life—we get it! Between your job, taking the kids to school and maintaining some semblance of a social life, juggling a day's tasks can be difficult. Weekly cleaning in your home seems impossible. With our professional cleaning service, we want to take one important task off your busy schedule.
Our family-owned cleaning service has been around for over 40 years, and we love serving your family! The Heiser Group offers both traditional and deep cleaning services. Our house cleaning services operate based on the convenience of our clients. Our services are available for as many or as few sessions as you desire on a monthly basis.
You work hard to keep your home in one piece. Let us work hard to keep it clean.
Our House Cleaning Services
Housecleaning generally provides services such as mopping floor surfaces, cleaning glass fixtures, dusting accessible surfaces among other services. Our housecleaners will bring their own cleaning supplies, so you never need to provide cleaning products for them.
Standard Cleaning Services
Our standard home cleaning services are tailored to fit your personal needs. Schedule to your convenience and our cleaning team will enter the home upon approval of the homeowner.
For a standard cleaning, our professional cleaning services typically take between 1 and 3 hours. Expect an outstanding job and a fresh, clean feel in your home.
Customer Love
Don't just take our word for it. See what our happy customers and long term clients have to say!
“After major remodeling and renovation in our building, it was a disaster. David came in and assessed the situation and sent his two best guys. In one evening, they cleaned the inside of the building completely. ”

Commercial Cleaning Services
Commercial Cleaning Services for Chicagoland Businesses
A clean and organized workspace is essential for any business to thrive. It not only leaves a good impression on your clients but also boosts the morale of your employees. Maintaining cleanliness in a commercial property requires a lot of effort and resources, especially when the business needs to run seamlessly without any interruptions. That's where The Heiser Group comes in! With years of experience in the industry, we offer comprehensive and customizable commercial cleaning solutions to meet the unique needs of businesses across Chicagoland.
Our Standard Cleaning Services
Our services are tailored to meet your specific needs. From janitorial services to carpet cleaning and more, we offer a wide range of services, including bathroom cleaning and disinfecting of surfaces in kitchen areas. Our highly trained and experienced cleaning experts utilize industry-leading equipment and techniques to deliver exceptional results. We are dedicated to creating a clean and healthy work environment for your business.
‍
Standard Professional Cleaning Services include:
Sweeping and mopping hard surface floors
Vacuuming carpeted areas
Removing all trash from waste baskets and receptacles
Cleaning and sanitizing bathroom and kitchen areas
Dusting horizontal surfaces
Spot-cleaning glass surfaces
Removing cobwebs
Popular Add-Ons:
Window Washing
Upholstery Cleaning
Power Washing
Our Industrial Cleaning Services
Our specialized cleaning services cater to the unique challenges and requirements of industrial facilities. With expertise in sanitizing various surfaces, handling hazardous chemicals and maintaining safety standards, we provide customized cleaning plans that address industry regulations. Our goal is to ensure a clean and safe environment for both employees and visitors.
What to Expect from The Heiser Group
With extensive service coverage across the Chicagoland area, The Heiser Group is committed to delivering excellence in every aspect of our work. We provide comprehensive liability insurance for peace of mind and offer efficient scheduling and flexibility to accommodate your schedule and business needs.
Service Coverage
We proudly serve businesses from Lake County, Illinois to Kenosha, Wisconsin, offering reliable and consistent commercial cleaning services. With our easy accessibility and local expertise, we cater to customers in multiple locations, providing prompt and efficient service tailored to the specific needs of customers in these communities.
Quality Control
To maintain high standards of cleanliness, we implement rigorous quality control measures. Our cleaning staff undergo thorough training programs, and we conduct regular inspections. We believe in constant communication with our clients to address any concerns, and we continuously strive to improve our service quality.
Safety Measures
As a professional commercial cleaning company, we prioritize the safety of our clients and employees. We strictly adhere to safety protocols and regulations, ensuring a clean work environment. Our cleaning staff receives ongoing training on safety procedures and uses eco-friendly, non-toxic cleaning products. We handle and dispose of hazardous materials properly, creating a safe, disinfected environment for everyone. We follow the guidelines provided by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to ensure effective disinfection against COVID-19 and other infections.
Customizable Cleaning Solutions
We offer tailored cleaning plans based on your industry type and flexible scheduling to save time and minimize disruption. We understand the uniqueness of different industries' cleaning requirements and address challenges and regulations. Let us create a clean work environment that meets your standards.
Professionalism and Expertise
With our decades of experience in the industry, our team of professional cleaning experts provides top-quality commercial cleaning services tailored to your specific needs. We prioritize customer service and strive for excellence in every cleaning job, ensuring a clean and healthy work environment.
Contact Us to Clean Your Business Space
Get a free consultation by contacting our trusted commercial cleaning company today. Our experienced team of professionals is committed to delivering great results, whether it's an office or a financial institution. Let us create a clean and healthy environment for your business.

Our team is dedicated to delivering high-quality results and meeting the unique needs of your business. Whether you require regular cleaning or emergency cleaning services, we have you covered.

With over 20 years of experience in the commercial cleaning industry, The Heiser Group is committed to providing top-quality cleaning services. We constantly evolve and adapt to meet the needs of our clients.

text:
Realty Cleaning | Perfecting Showing in Chicagoland
Our Realty Cleaning service is satisfaction guaranteed for all realtors, homebuyers, and clients. The Heiser Group ensures that with our thorough cleaning, your property will be picture perfect and ready to leave the best first impression every time.
As a real estate agent, one of your major responsibilities is to make sure that all houses you show are clean. The most essential thing to accomplish when trying to sell a property is to enhance the details of the space and keep the maintenance up to date. A filthy house may have a significant influence on the final price and the amount of time it takes to sell. From the floors through the kitchen and bathrooms to the windows, driveway, and garage, real estate cleaning will create the vision for potential buyers of making this house - their home.
That is when our cleaning business comes in to help! We have worked with countless realtors and understand your specific needs and priorities. We strive to provide the best cleaning that will help you sell houses more quickly and make a bigger commission.
The distinction between attempting to sell a filthy house and one that has been properly cleaned is like ‘night and day.' As a result, displaying a clean home pays big dividends. It is always worth the investment to hire a professional cleaning company like The Heiser Group to clean your properties prior to listing them.
Think about it – would you rather buy a house that’s been well-maintained or one that looks like it’s been neglected? We have all seen those real estate listings where the pictures make the house look so unkempt and dirty that you can barely bring yourself to walk through the front door. On the other hand, a home that’s been cleaned by professionals will make buyers feel comfortable and encourage them to take their time touring the property and imagining themselves living there.
At The Heiser Group, we understand that first impressions are everything in real estate. We are detail oriented and provide periodic cleaning services for the one buyer it takes to walk through the door and know that this home is their perfect place.

text:
Bi-Weekly Cleaning Service | Residential & Commercial
What do I get in a bi-weekly cleaning service?
A bi-weekly cleaning service includes a range of cleaning tasks that are performed every other week to maintain the cleanliness of your home or office. The specific tasks may vary depending on your needs and preferences. Common cleaning tasks include:
Dusting all surfaces, including furniture, shelves, picture frames, and decorative items
Cleaning bathrooms, including scrubbing toilets, sinks, showers, and bathtubs
Cleaning the kitchen, including the counters, stove, microwave, refrigerator exterior, and sink
Vacuuming carpets and area rugs
Sweeping and mopping hard floors
Cleaning mirrors and windows
Removing trash and recycling from your home or office
In addition to regular cleaning services and these standard cleaning tasks, some bi-weekly cleaning services may offer additional services for an extra fee. These services may include deep cleaning of specific areas, such as the oven, refrigerator, or cabinets, laundry services, and organization of cluttered areas.
We'll discuss your specific cleaning needs and preferences beforehand to ensure that we tailor our services to your needs. This will help our cleaning crew ensure that you are satisfied with the results of the bi-weekly cleaning service.
Kitchen Cleaning
Prone to grease and food spills, kitchens tend to be one of the hardest rooms to keep clean. However, they are one of the most important sections of the house to maintain tidy and neat. The kitchen is the heart of the home where loved ones gather to prepare a meal, share news, and spend time together. Impress your clients with a deep clean that accentuates those surfaces. Not only will The Heiser Group's professional cleaning services thoroughly wash your flooring, we'll also ensure that each of your primary appliances convey a fresh, good-as-new aesthetic. We focus on equipment detailed cleaning and that includes the tough grime on the sinks, stovetop, oven and more.
Living Room Cleaning
Your living room is the center of attention; it's great for hosting or for just relaxing after a hard day's work. New homeowners prioritize this living space. When The Heiser Group takes on a living room, we want to make your home sparkle leaving it so your buyers can feel at home, too. We will touch on everything from ceiling fans, light fixtures, surface dusting, even the fireplace too.
Bathroom Cleaning
Bathrooms are highly susceptible to mold and mildew growth, producing harmful health effects. The last thing your clients want to see is soap scum residue on the counter or stains in the toilet. When cleaning your bathroom, The Heiser Group will clean everything from your toilet to your shower in an eco-friendly manner. Our cleaning service will add the complete finishing touch to the house and won't leave you with any unwanted odors.
Basement Cleaning
Although often forgotten about, a sparkling, modern basement can be all it takes to seal the deal. With The Heiser Group's basement cleaning service, we'll give you a streak-free floor and send the debris and dust bunnies heading for the hills. If there is a potential room for an office space in the basement, it is essential to keep it clean. A client doesn't need additional convincing with an extra space like this.
‍
Bedroom Cleaning
Did you know that the average American spends 36 years, or nearly half of their life, in bed? Since we dedicate so much time to our bedrooms, they should look amazing. The Heiser Group will give you a room that buyers won't mind sleeping in - they will be running for the sheets.
Garage Cleaning
Although not always physically attached, the garage is an extension of your property. After The Heiser Group conducts a power washing to the flooring, your garage will feel more inviting to potential buyers. Whether they'll use it for a vehicle or storage, it shouldn't be out of sight or out of mind for a cleaning.
Frequently Asked Questions
GENERAL QUESTIONS
What is a bi-weekly clean?
A bi-weekly clean refers to a recurring service where cleaning tasks are performed every two weeks. The cleaning includes various tasks, such as vacuuming, dusting, wiping down surfaces, cleaning bathrooms, and more.
What do I get in a bi-weekly cleaning service?
The Heiser Group can create a contract for any term length. However, to ensure that you’re continually thrilled with the quality of our work, each of our agreements offers a 30-day release clause. To learn more about our contracts, contact us today.
How often should I get professional cleaning services?
Every space has unique cleaning needs, so we work closely with our clients to create customized monthly cleaning service plans that meet their specific requirements. With every company looking for ways to safely allow their customers and members back, gyms have found it particularly tough. So tough that staples in the industry, like Gold’s Gym, are being forced to file for bankruptcy. Many gyms are turning to electrostatic disinfection as the answer.

Not only will The Heiser Group's professional cleaning services thoroughly wash your flooring, we'll also ensure that each of your primary appliances convey a fresh, good-as-new aesthetic. We focus on equipment detailed cleaning and that includes the tough grime on the sinks, stovetop, oven and more.

## Living Room Cleaning

Your living room is the center of attention; it's great for hosting or for just relaxing after a hard day's work. New homeowners prioritize this living space. When The Heiser Group takes on a living room, we want to make your home sparkle leaving it so your buyers can feel at home, too. We will touch on everything from ceiling fans, light fixtures, surface dusting, even the fireplace too.

![Real Estate Cleaning](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/60b80a86a8a100622af4963a/62f1748037f05d5815fb196a_Real_Estate_Cleaning_5.webp)

## Bathroom Cleaning

Bathrooms are highly susceptible to mold and mildew growth, producing harmful health effects. The last thing your clients want to see is soap scum residue on the counter or stains in the toilet. When cleaning your bathroom, The Heiser Group will clean everything from your toilet to your shower in an eco-friendly manner. Our cleaning service will add the complete finishing touch to the house and won't leave you with any unwanted odors.

## Basement Cleaning

Although often forgotten about, a sparkling, modern basement can be all it takes to seal the deal. With The Heiser Group's basement cleaning service, we'll give you a streak-free floor and send the debris and dust bunnies heading for the hills. If there is a potential room for an office space in the basement, it is essential to keep it clean. A client doesn't need additional convincing with an extra space like this.

‍

## Bedroom Cleaning

Did you know that the average American spends 36 years, or nearly half of their life, in bed? Since we dedicate so much time to our bedrooms, they should look amazing. The Heiser Group will give you a room that buyers won't mind sleeping in - they will be running for the sheets.

## Garage Cleaning

Although not always physically attached, the garage is an extension of your property. After The Heiser Group conducts a power washing to the flooring, your garage will feel more inviting to potential buyers. Whether they'll use it for a vehicle or storage, it shouldn't be out of sight or out of mind for a cleaning.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### **What are the benefits of hiring a monthly cleaning service?**

Hiring a monthly cleaning service ensures a consistently clean and organized space, reduces stress, saves time, and maintains a healthier environment by reducing allergens and germs. Regular cleaning also helps extend the lifespan of furniture and fixtures, providing long-term cost savings.

GENERAL QUESTIONS

### **How do you ensure the quality of your cleaning services?**

Quality control is of utmost importance to us. We maintain high professional standards to ensure cleaning excellence. From using top-quality cleaning products to following rigorous cleaning protocols, every step is taken to deliver the highest level of cleanliness. We also offer a satisfaction guarantee, ensuring that our customers are always happy with the results. Your satisfaction is our priority.

### **Can I customize my monthly cleaning service plan?**

Absolutely! We understand that every home and every client is unique. We offer personalized service and a flexible cleaning plan that can be tailored to meet your specific needs. Whether you require additional cleaning in certain areas or have specific preferences, we are committed to providing a cleaning service that is customized to your requirements. We are here to make your monthly cleaning experience hassle-free and convenient. To learn more about our services, [contact us today](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact).

### **What makes your cleaning products eco-friendly?**

We are dedicated to using environmentally friendly cleaning products. We prioritize the health and safety of our clients and the planet by using non-toxic and eco-friendly cleaning solutions. Our green cleaning approach ensures a clean and healthy home without compromising the environment. When you choose us, you can have peace of mind knowing that your home is cleaned using safe and sustainable cleaning products.

### **How do I schedule my first cleaning appointment?**

Scheduling your first cleaning appointment with us is easy and convenient. Simply reach out to our customer service team, and they will guide you through the booking process. We offer an initial consultation to understand your cleaning needs and preferences, ensuring that your first appointment is tailored to your requirements. To learn more about our services, [contact us today](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact).  

### **What should I do if I'm not satisfied with the cleaning service?**

We pride ourselves on providing excellent customer service and ensuring customer satisfaction. If you're not completely satisfied with the cleaning service, simply reach out to our customer service team, and they will be happy to address any concerns. We offer a satisfaction guarantee, so you can have confidence that any issues will be resolved promptly and to your satisfaction. Your happiness is our priority.

### **Are there any preparation steps I need to take before the cleaning team arrives?**

To ensure an efficient and effective cleaning service, we recommend a few simple preparation steps before our team arrives. These may include decluttering surfaces, picking up any personal items, and securing any valuables. Clearing the spaces to be cleaned allows our cleaning team to focus on providing a thorough clean and ensures that no items are accidentally misplaced or damaged. By following these pre-cleaning instructions, you can help us deliver the best possible cleaning results.

### **How do you handle missed appointments or rescheduling?**

We understand that life can be unpredictable, and changes to schedules may be necessary. If you need to reschedule a cleaning appointment, simply contact our customer service team, and they will work with you to find a new convenient time. In the rare event of a missed appointment, we will accommodate you by rescheduling at the earliest available time. Our commitment to service reliability ensures that you can rely on us for consistent and dependable cleaning services.  

### **Do you offer any other types of cleaning services besides monthly?**

Yes, we offer a range of cleaning services to meet various needs. In addition to monthly cleaning, we also provide weekly house cleaning services for those who require more frequent cleaning. We also offer special event preparation and cleanup, ensuring that your space is ready for any occasion. Whatever your cleaning needs may be, we have a variety of cleaning options to choose from, allowing you to customize the level and frequency of cleaning that best suits your lifestyle.

About Us
The Heiser Group is a janitorial services and industrial cleaning business based in Buffalo Grove, Illinois. Founded on May 5th, 1978, The Heiser Group is a family-owned and operated business in its third generation of “Heiser”.
Since the company’s inception, the Heiser family has implemented four key pillars that set us apart from the competition: Honesty, Integrity, Quality, & Service.
David’s grandfather and father believed that any company can clean a building, but going the extra mile can separate a normal janitorial company from a great one.
We pride ourselves on doing just that, offering commercial and residential cleaning with a personal touch.

# About Us

The Heiser Group is a janitorial services and industrial cleaning business based in Buffalo Grove, Illinois. Founded on May 5th, 1978, The Heiser Group is a family-owned and operated business in its third generation of “Heiser”.

Since the company’s inception, the Heiser family has implemented four key pillars that set us apart from the competition: Honesty, Integrity, Quality, & Service.

David’s grandfather and father believed that any company can clean a building, but going the extra mile can separate a normal janitorial company from a great one.

We pride ourselves on doing just that, offering commercial and residential cleaning with a personal touch.

metadata.title: Christmas Home Cleaning
metadata.description: As we prepare for the busy holiday season, make sure your kitchen is in working order to help you prepare feasts and host guests during this year's festivities.

text:
Christmas Home Cleaning
Christmas Home Cleaning
As we prepare for this holiday season, Christmas home cleaning requests have seen their annual spike.
Whether you have guests or not, Christmas time still has its own nuances when it comes to maintaining a clean home.
Keep Your Christmas Tree Neat and Tidy When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning
As much as we all love pulling out and setting up our Christmas trees, they can be a major source of dirt, dust, and more if you are not cleaning them daily. This is especially true if you choose to go with a live tree over a synthetic one.
CLEANING YOUR LIVE TREE
Live trees drop a lot of needles onto the ground over the course of their lifespan as your home tree. Try to sweep up as many as possible using a broom and dustpan before resorting to the vacuum because these little needles can harm your vacuum.
Second, watch out for fallen sap that could harm your floor if left alone too long. Most trees will not drop very much but it is known to happen, especially from the base when you first set it up at home.
CARING FOR A FAKE TREE
Synthetic trees are much easier to clean. Most just need some touching up after you take them out of the box they have been staying in for the past 11 months. A simple dusting usually does the trick, but you may need to run a wet rag over some branches to remove any buildup. Try to do this outside to avoid filling your house with dust!
Remember to Clean Your Carpet When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning
With all that happens during the holidays—gift shopping, having friends and family over, decorating, eating, and more—it can be easy to forget that your carpet goes through a lot of wear and tear during this time.
With constant foot traffic, mud, snow, water, salt, ice, and more being dropped on it, you need to clean it fairly often to make sure nothing gets set in and becomes hard to remove.
Prepare Your Kitchen for Family Meals When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning
Thanksgiving is just the start of the family feasting season for many of us which means you need to get your kitchen in tip-top shape.
First, be sure the inside of your oven is clean of any dropped foods that could cause bad smells or smoking. Also, clean off your stovetop of any caked-on messes on the burners.
Second, it is time to clean and polish your silverware, plates, bowls, cups, and more to make sure they are spotless for your guests.
And lastly, make sure the inside of your refrigerator is clean and ready to store leftovers, pies, drinks, and more during your holiday parties.
Christmas time, for many, is truly the greatest time of the year but it does bring lots of cleaning with it. Make sure you follow these tips to keep your kitchen clean and ready to host during the holidays.
For help with your Christmas home cleaning, get in touch with the residential cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.
markdown:
# Christmas Home Cleaning

## Christmas Home Cleaning

As we prepare for this holiday season, Christmas home cleaning requests have seen their annual spike.

Whether you have guests or not, Christmas time still has its own nuances when it comes to maintaining a clean home.

## Keep Your Christmas Tree Neat and Tidy When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning

As much as we all love pulling out and setting up our Christmas trees, they can be a major source of dirt, dust, and more if you are not cleaning them daily. This is especially true if you choose to go with a live tree over a synthetic one.

### CLEANING YOUR LIVE TREE

Live trees drop a lot of needles onto the ground over the course of their lifespan as your home tree. Try to sweep up as many as possible using a broom and dustpan before resorting to the vacuum because these little needles can harm your vacuum.

Second, watch out for fallen sap that could harm your floor if left alone too long. Most trees will not drop very much but it is known to happen, especially from the base when you first set it up at home.

### CARING FOR A FAKE TREE

Synthetic trees are much easier to clean. Most just need some touching up after you take them out of the box they have been staying in for the past 11 months. A simple dusting usually does the trick, but you may need to run a wet rag over some branches to remove any buildup. Try to do this outside to avoid filling your house with dust!

## Remember to Clean Your Carpet When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning

With all that happens during the holidays—gift shopping, having friends and family over, decorating, eating, and more—it can be easy to forget that your carpet goes through a lot of wear and tear during this time.

With constant foot traffic, mud, snow, water, salt, ice, and more being dropped on it, you need to clean it fairly often to make sure nothing gets set in and becomes hard to remove.

## Prepare Your Kitchen for Family Meals When Conducting Your Christmas Home Cleaning

Thanksgiving is just the start of the family feasting season for many of us which means you need to get your kitchen in tip-top shape.

First, be sure the inside of your oven is clean of any dropped foods that could cause bad smells or smoking. Also, clean off your stovetop of any caked-on messes on the burners.

Second, it is time to clean and polish your silverware, plates, bowls, cups, and more to make sure they are spotless for your guests.

And lastly, make sure the inside of your refrigerator is clean and ready to store leftovers, pies, drinks, and more during your holiday parties.

Christmas time, for many, is truly the greatest time of the year but it does bring lots of cleaning with it. Make sure you follow these tips to keep your kitchen clean and ready to host during the holidays.

For help with your Christmas home cleaning, [**get in touch with the residential cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: 3 Hardwood Floor Cleaning Tips for Your Home or Office
metadata.description: Cleaning your hardwood floor, whether it be in your home or office, is not something you want to take lightly or do without researching first.A well-maintained hardwood floor can last a long time, so make sure you know exactly what you need to do to take care of it. Here are some simple tips to help you clean.

text:
3 Hardwood Floor Cleaning Tips for Your Home or Office
3 Hardwood Floor Cleaning Tips for Your Home or Office
Cleaning your hardwood floor, whether it be in your home or office, is not something you want to take lightly or do without researching first.
A well-maintained hardwood floor can last a long time, so make sure you know exactly what you need to do to take care of it. Here are some simple tips to help you clean.
1. USE PROTECTION WHEN MOVING YOUR FURNITURE
To get to every square of flooring, you’ll have to move some furniture around. Hardwood floors can easily be scratched, nicked, or chipped if you do this the wrong way. The best, easiest, and cheapest way to move furniture is to use simple protection in the form of:
Sliders: These are designed to be permanently attached to the base of your furniture so, when the time comes to clean, they can be easily and safely moved.
Felt pads: Like sliders, these are attached to your furniture and are designed to protect your floor.
Furniture Blankets: These are the largest option that would work best for the largest, hard-to-move furniture. These work by sliding them under heavier or larger pieces of furniture and then using them to move the furniture away.
2. VACUUM OR SWEEP BEFORE MOPPING
Before you set out with a mop, you’ll want to vacuum or sweep your hardwood floor to get the lighter dust and dirt and pick up any larger pieces that have settled onto it.
When it comes to choosing a vacuum, be sure you buy one that is designed to work on wooden floors and provides the correct suction to be useful on a hard surface. If you’re working with multiple types of surfaces (carpets, tiles, etc.) you can buy a multi-surface vacuum.
However, if you absolutely have to use a vacuum not designed for hardwood, be sure to remove the “beater bar”, which can damage the finish on the floor, and attach any brush attachments available to help kick up the dirt and grime.
3. USE THE RIGHT PRODUCTS WHEN MOPPING HARDWOOD FLOORS
After you’ve finished vacuuming or sweeping, you can use a mop to fully clean some of the higher traffic areas of your floor.
If using a traditional string mop, be sure to squeeze out as much moisture as you can. Using too much water can leave you in danger of having standing water, which can easily damage hardwood flooring.
Another option for mopping is a microfiber pad mop. Microfiber works to attract and trap dirt and grime and uses less moisture. Products like a Swiffer Wet Jet lets you spray out just as much liquid cleaner as you need.
As far as products go, it’s generally best to go with a cleaner designed for hardwood cleaning. These will be gentlest on your finish, produce the best shine, and clean up the messes generally found on wooden floors.
USE PROFESSIONAL CLEANING SERVICES
If you have any doubts or want to be sure your floor is cleaned in the safest, quickest, and most effective way, it’s never a bad idea to go with a professional cleaning service. This will remove any doubt that your floor is as clean as it can be and is being taken care of in the right way.
Whether you’re prepping a home for sale or trying to make your office hardwood flooring look spick and span, The Heiser Group has got you covered. Send us a message to set up a free consultation today with one of our specialists.
‍

# 3 Hardwood Floor Cleaning Tips for Your Home or Office

## 3 Hardwood Floor Cleaning Tips for Your Home or Office

Cleaning your hardwood floor, whether it be in your home or office, is not something you want to take lightly or do without researching first.

A [well-maintained hardwood floor can last a long time](https://floorcritics.com/how-to-clean-hardwood/), so make sure you know exactly what you need to do to take care of it. Here are some simple tips to help you clean.

## 1\. USE PROTECTION WHEN MOVING YOUR FURNITURE

To get to every square of flooring, you’ll have to move some furniture around. Hardwood floors can easily be scratched, nicked, or chipped if you do this the wrong way. The best, easiest, and cheapest way to move furniture is to use simple protection in the form of:

*   **Sliders:** These are designed to be permanently attached to the base of your furniture so, when the time comes to clean, they can be easily and safely moved.
*   **Felt pads:** Like sliders, these are attached to your furniture and are designed to protect your floor.
*   **Furniture Blankets:** These are the largest option that would work best for the largest, hard-to-move furniture. These work by sliding them under heavier or larger pieces of furniture and then using them to move the furniture away.

## 2\. VACUUM OR SWEEP BEFORE MOPPING

Before you set out with a mop, you’ll want to vacuum or sweep your hardwood floor to get the lighter dust and dirt and pick up any larger pieces that have settled onto it.

When it comes to choosing a vacuum, be sure you buy one that is designed to work on wooden floors and provides the correct suction to be useful on a hard surface. If you’re working with multiple types of surfaces (carpets, tiles, etc.) you can buy a multi-surface vacuum.

However, if you absolutely have to use a vacuum not designed for hardwood, [be sure to remove the “beater bar”](https://www.diynetwork.com/how-to/maintenance-and-repair/cleaning/how-to-clean-hardwood-floors), which can damage the finish on the floor, and attach any brush attachments available to help kick up the dirt and grime.

## 3\. USE THE RIGHT PRODUCTS WHEN MOPPING HARDWOOD FLOORS

After you’ve finished vacuuming or sweeping, you can use a mop to fully clean some of the higher traffic areas of your floor.

If using [a traditional string mop](https://mopcenter.net/10-types-of-mops-for-your-home-floor-cleaning/), be sure to squeeze out as much moisture as you can. Using too much water can [leave you in danger of having standing water](https://www.homedepot.com/c/ah/how-to-clean-hardwood-floors/9ba683603be9fa5395fab9003d4dbd3), which can easily damage hardwood flooring.

Another option for mopping is a microfiber pad mop. Microfiber works to attract and trap dirt and grime and uses less moisture. Products like a [Swiffer Wet Jet](https://swiffer.com/en-us/shop-products/mopping/swiffer-wetjet-mop-starter-kit) lets you spray out just as much liquid cleaner as you need.

As far as products go, it’s generally best to go with a cleaner designed for hardwood cleaning. These will be gentlest on your finish, produce the best shine, and [clean up the messes generally found on wooden floors.](https://www.thisoldhouse.com/ideas/how-to-clean-wood-floors)

## USE PROFESSIONAL CLEANING SERVICES

If you have any doubts or want to be sure your floor is cleaned in the safest, quickest, and most effective way, it’s never a bad idea to go with a professional cleaning service. This will remove any doubt that your floor is as clean as it can be and is being taken care of in the right way.

Whether you’re prepping a home for sale or trying to make your office hardwood flooring look spick and span, The Heiser Group has got you covered. [**Send us a message to set up a free consultation today with one of our specialists.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: 5 Tips for Cleaning and Sanitizing Your Home or Office Kitchen
metadata.description: A shared kitchen in your home or office is one of the most high-traffic areas. It’s also a natural haven for the spread of bacteria and germs.Whether it’s in your home or your office, keeping your kitchen well-cleaned is crucial for a healthy space. Here are five tips from The Heiser Group for cleaning and sanitizing your home or office kitchen.

text:
5 Tips for Cleaning and Sanitizing Your Home or Office Kitchen
5 Tips for Cleaning and Sanitizing Your Home or Office Kitchen
A shared kitchen in your home or office is one of the most high-traffic areas. It’s also a natural haven for the spread of bacteria and germs.
Whether it’s in your home or your office, keeping your kitchen well-cleaned is crucial for a healthy space. Here are five tips from The Heiser Group for cleaning and sanitizing your home or office kitchen.
IMPLEMENT CLEAR CLEANING POLICIES
The easiest way to enforce the tips we’ll mention in this article is to make sure everyone knows the rules and policies of your kitchen. List out what people are expected to do when using the shared kitchen area. 
These may include:
Clean up the microwave after each use
Wipe up any spills or messes immediately
Don’t leave old food in the fridge
Only use clean dishes and silverware
If everyone knows the rules, there’s no doubt what needs to be done, and if everyone does their part, you’ll have a cleaner and healthier kitchen space.
KEEP CLEANING SUPPLIES STOCKED AND READILY AVAILABLE
If cleaning supplies like Lysol wipes, paper towels, and all-purpose cleaners are readily available, the fight to keep your kitchen clean is greatly reduced.
The types of cleaners varies depending on the equipment, but a good starter list would look like this:
All-purpose Cleaner: Something that covers all ranges of messes and is in an easily-accessed spray bottle.
Disinfectant wipes: These are an absolute necessity. Having them within reach greatly increases the chances people will use them. A quick wipe down after using any equipment is a big step toward a clean kitchen.
Paper towels: If you don’t have a way to clean reusable rags, having paper towels stocked is the next best thing. 
Degreaser: To keep bacteria from building up in a toaster oven or microwave, it’s important to remove the caked on residue that gets left over. A simple degreasing spray—paired with a paper towel—is the best way to make sure everything comes off when cleaning.
Broom: Crumbs build up fast when you have so many people sharing a food preparation place. A quick sweeping everyday will keep the floors from gathering dirt, dust, and food. This is also the best way to keep pests like ants and roaches away.
Mold cleaner: It’s almost inevitable that you’ll find mold at some point in a kitchen. An all-purpose cleaner might do the trick, but using a designated anti-mold cleaner is the only way to make sure you kill off every bit.
ALWAYS CLEAN UP AFTER YOURSELF
No matter the rules or policies in place, it’s up to everyone to pitch in to keep a shared kitchen space clean and healthy. Don’t let spills sit around and harden, clean up all crumbs, and wipe down used surfaces or appliances.
SANITIZE HIGH-ACTIVITY AREAS WITHIN YOUR KITCHEN
The most-touched parts of your kitchen, things that nearly everyone will come into contact with at some point, must be sanitized with disinfectant wipes as often as possible. 
Areas to clean are:
Cabinet Handles
Microwave Handles & Buttons
Coffee Machines
Counters
Fridge Handles
Toaster Ovens
HIRE A COMMERCIAL CLEANER
Nobody can do a better job than the pros. If you have any doubts about the cleanliness of your kitchen and the safety of your staff because of it, go with the experts. 
Hiring a commercial cleaning company like The Heiser Group means
You’ll never have to worry about forgetting to clean
You’ll have no doubts whether or not your kitchen is at its absolute cleanest
You’ll have the peace of mind of a clean working space.
The kitchen is a busy place and with so many liquids and foods it’s an easy location for germs to spread quickly through many people. So, make sure you’re doing everything you can to ensure everyone’s safety by keeping it as clean as possible.
For help with commercial cleaning, call in the home or office kitchen specialists at The Heiser Group.
‍

metadata.title: 3 Tips for Cleaning a Carpeted Office
metadata.description: Having a carpeted office has its benefits, such as comfort, but it lacks in the area of cleanliness. Where on tile you instantly notice stains, dust, and crumbs, in a carpet they can go unnoticed for days. And, obviously, removing stains is much tougher.Here are a few tips to help your office maintain a cleaner workplace carpet.

text:
3 Tips for Cleaning a Carpeted Office
3 Tips for Cleaning a Carpeted Office
Having a carpeted office has its benefits, such as comfort, but it lacks in the area of cleanliness. 
Where on tile you instantly notice stains, dust, and crumbs, in a carpet they can go unnoticed for days. And, obviously, removing stains is much tougher.
Here are a few tips to help your office maintain a cleaner workplace carpet.
1. Vacuuming and basic upkeep
We’ll start with the most obvious which is to vacuum regularly, and have a cleaning plan in place so that it never goes too long without being cleaned.
Vacuuming is the most important factor in maintaining your carpet (and doing so will pick up ~80% of the dirt found in it.) So, you should ideally vacuum everyday but, let’s face it, nobody has time for that, so every few days should be fine.
For the remaining 20% of the dirt and debris not picked up by the vacuum, you’ll need to do a little deep cleaning. For this, you can call in an expert (as we will note below) or do some cleaning with basic tools like vinegar, baking soda, and a detergent.
2. Have a Plan for Spills and Stains
Catching a spill early is the key to preventing it from setting and affecting your carpet long term. So, firstly, you need to have the tools readily available to everyone in the office.
Make it known where they are and how to use them. This knowledge will help people know exactly what to do and reduce the chances somebody spills and forgets.
For products to use, there are a huge number of readily available remedies sold in stores to help deal with hard stains and, most of the time, all you need is some product, a brush, and a vacuum, which should all be already in your office.
If no cleaner is available, there are seemingly infinite home remedies using other things you may find around the office like salt, vinegar, and even WD-40.
3. When in Doubt, Go With the Pros
If things get out of hand or you start to notice lingering smells or stains, it might be time to call in the professionals and be sure to do everything you can to prepare the office for their arrival:
Remove fragile and breakable items from the area waiting to be cleaned so that nothing of value is broken or lost.
Move furniture and clear the way for the cleaners to make sure nothing hinders them from doing the job.
Find the areas that need cleaning the heaviest to show the cleaners where to concentrate their efforts.
If you have a carpeted office, you may not know everything that needs to be done to keep it clean as clean as possible. That’s where The Heiser Group comes into play.
Contact us today to get started.

markdown:
# 3 Tips for Cleaning a Carpeted Office

## 3 Tips for Cleaning a Carpeted Office

Having a carpeted office has its benefits, such as comfort, but it lacks in the area of cleanliness.

Where on tile you instantly notice stains, dust, and crumbs, in a carpet they can go unnoticed for days. And, obviously, removing stains is much tougher.

Here are a few tips to help your office maintain a cleaner workplace carpet.

## 1\. Vacuuming and basic upkeep

We’ll start with the most obvious which is to **vacuum regularly,** and have a cleaning plan in place so that it never goes too long without being cleaned.

[Vacuuming is the most important factor in maintaining your carpet (and doing so will pick up ~80% of the dirt found in it.)](https://blog.millikencarpet.com/5-carpet-cleaning-tips-to-make-your-office-carpet-last-longer) So, you should ideally vacuum everyday but, let’s face it, nobody has time for that, so every few days should be fine.

For the remaining 20% of the dirt and debris not picked up by the vacuum, you’ll need to do a little deep cleaning. For this, you can call in an expert (as we will note below) or do some cleaning with [basic tools like vinegar, baking soda, and a detergent.](https://www.apartmenttherapy.com/how-to-deep-clean-your-carpets-138567)

## 2\. Have a Plan for Spills and Stains

Catching a spill early is the key to preventing it from setting and affecting your carpet long term. So, firstly, you need to have the tools readily available to everyone in the office.

Make it known where they are and how to use them. This knowledge will help people know exactly what to do and reduce the chances somebody spills and forgets.

For products to use, there are a huge number of readily available remedies sold in stores to help deal with hard stains and, most of the time, all you need is some product, a brush, and a vacuum, which should all be already in your office.

If no cleaner is available, there are [seemingly infinite home remedies using other things you may find around the office like salt, vinegar, and even WD-40.](https://www.rd.com/home/cleaning-organizing/homemade-carpet-stain-removers/)

## 3\. When in Doubt, Go With the Pros

If things get out of hand or you start to notice lingering smells or stains, it might be time to call in the professionals and [be sure to do everything you can to prepare the office for their arrival](https://www.angieslist.com/articles/what-do-carpet-cleaner-arrives.htm):

*   **Remove fragile and breakable items from the area waiting to be cleaned** so that nothing of value is broken or lost.
*   **Move furniture and clear the way for the cleaners** to make sure nothing hinders them from doing the job.
*   **Find the areas that need cleaning the heaviest** to show the cleaners where to concentrate their efforts.

If you have a carpeted office, you may not know everything that needs to be done to keep it clean as clean as possible. That’s where The Heiser Group comes into play.

[Contact us today to get started.](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

MAKE EVERYONE RESPONSIBLE

metadata.title: How Airlines Are Using Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays
metadata.description: In a business that moves as quickly as air travel, finding the time to fully clean a plane in between trips is difficult without delaying flights and causing frustration among travelers. But, with the events of today, it became an absolute must.So, airlines found a solution: electrostatic disinfectant spraying.

text:
How Airlines Are Using Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays
How Airlines Are Using Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays
In a business that moves as quickly as air travel, finding the time to fully clean a plane in between trips is difficult without delaying flights and causing frustration among travelers. But, with the events of today, it became an absolute must.
So, airlines found a solution: electrostatic disinfectant spraying.
Quick, Effective Cleaning
Electrostatic disinfectant spraying has a lot of benefits for airlines. Firstly, it’s a quick way to perform a top-to-bottom cleaning of an aircraft that won’t get in the way of schedules and doesn’t require an immense amount of manpower to perform. Just a few spray guns, a walk down the aisle, and the electrically charged particles will find every surface and cling to them.
The solution can fight most tough germs, covers surfaces evenly (no need to wipe it around), and is safe to touch immediately after being used so travelers don’t have to wait long after it’s used.
The second main benefit, and the reason it works in the first place, is that it’s a highly effective way to disinfect large areas. The charged particles in the spray seek out and cling to surfaces which means it’s able to completely disinfect seats, arm rests, tray tables, doors, bathrooms, and galleys.
How Does Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Work?
The disinfectant solution becomes charged when it leaves the nozzle. These charged particles then cling to surfaces—and resist each other—so they cover the most surface area. The particles not only cling but will wrap around and completely cover whatever surface it lands on.
This evenly and completely covers all surfaces and takes away the risk of missing surfaces that happens with manual cleaning—not to mention it takes significantly less manpower and time.
Electrostatic Disinfectant spray has become a must-have part of every airline’s health strategy in recent months. Along with masks and general hygiene practices by crew and passengers, airlines can successfully fight the spread and sanitize their planes before departure.
To schedule an electrostatic disinfectant spray service for your facility, reach out to the commercial cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.

markdown:
# How Airlines Are Using Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays

## How Airlines Are Using Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays

In a business that moves as quickly as air travel, finding the time to fully clean a plane in between trips is difficult without delaying flights and causing frustration among travelers. But, with the events of today, it became an absolute must.

So, airlines found a solution: electrostatic disinfectant spraying.

## Quick, Effective Cleaning

Electrostatic disinfectant spraying has a lot of benefits for airlines. Firstly, it’s a quick way to perform a top-to-bottom cleaning of an aircraft that won’t get in the way of schedules and doesn’t require an immense amount of manpower to perform. Just a few spray guns, a walk down the aisle, and the electrically charged particles will find every surface and cling to them.

The solution can fight most tough germs, covers surfaces evenly (no need to wipe it around), and is safe to touch immediately after being used so travelers don’t have to wait long after it’s used.

The second main benefit, and the reason it works in the first place, is that it’s a highly effective way to disinfect large areas. The charged particles in the spray seek out and cling to surfaces which means it’s able to completely disinfect seats, arm rests, tray tables, doors, bathrooms, and galleys.

## How Does Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Work?

The disinfectant solution becomes charged when it leaves the nozzle. These charged particles then cling to surfaces—and resist each other—so they cover the most surface area. The particles not only cling but will wrap around and completely cover whatever surface it lands on.

This evenly and completely covers all surfaces and takes away the risk of missing surfaces that happens with manual cleaning—not to mention it takes significantly less manpower and time.

Electrostatic Disinfectant spray has become a must-have part of every airline’s health strategy in recent months. Along with masks and general hygiene practices by crew and passengers, airlines can successfully fight the spread and sanitize their planes before departure.

To schedule an electrostatic disinfectant spray service for your facility, [reach out to the commercial cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

text:
Professional Carpet Shampoo & Carpet Cleaning
‍
Whether you need carpet shampooing for your home, office or commercial property, our team of trained technicians is ready to help you maintain a clean and healthy space. While regular vacuuming can remove surface dirt, professional carpet shampooing goes beyond the surface to penetrate deep into the fibers, eliminating tough stains, pet dander, allergens and odors.
Carpet Cleaning Services
The Heiser Group implements two primary methods for specialty carpet cleaning: hot water extraction and bonnet cleaning.
Hot Water Extraction
Commonly known as steam carpet cleaning, our hot water extraction service introduces highly pressurized hot water to agitate the carpet fibers and dissolve dirt in the carpet. This involves applying a cleaning agent, agitating the carpet fibers with a rotary brush and a final rinsing.
Bonnet Cleaning
Unlike hot water extraction, our bonnet cleaning service focuses primarily on the carpet's surface. We apply a heavy duty motorized rotary machine into a cleaning agent, and then apply the spinning bonnet pad to the carpet fibers. This process absorbs dirt from the carpeting and is great for a rapid spot-cleaning.
Carpet Shampooing Process
At The Heiser Group, our carpet shampooing process is designed to leave your carpets fresh and odor-free. While specific steps of the process may differ depending on your selected service, the end result remains the same: clean carpets.
Pre-Cleaning Inspection
We understand that every carpet is different, with specific cleaning requirements. That's why our carpet shampooing process begins with a comprehensive pre-cleaning inspection. Our trained technicians assess the condition of your carpet, taking note of any stains, pet accidents or high-traffic areas that require special attention. This inspection allows us to tailor our cleaning approach to your specific needs, ensuring the best results. By identifying problem areas, we can effectively treat stains, remove deep-seated dirt and restore the beauty of your carpets. Our attention to detail during the pre-cleaning inspection sets the stage for a thorough and effective carpet shampooing process that exceeds your expectations.
Stain and Spot Treatment
Our carpet shampooing process includes specialized stain and spot treatment to target stubborn stains and blemishes. To effectively tackle stains, we use professional stain removers and natural carpet cleaner, minimizing the use of harsh chemicals. Our stain and spot treatment process includes:
Identification of tough stains and spots
Application of stain remover on problem areas
Gentle scrubbing to break down stains
Extraction of loosened stains and residue
Thorough rinsing to remove any remaining traces of stains
Deep Cleaning Shampoo
After stain and spot treatment, our carpet shampooing process moves on to deep cleaning shampoo. We use a professional carpet cleaning machine, along with our professional strength carpet shampoo, to penetrate deep into the carpet fibers and efficiently remove embedded dirt, allergens, pet dander and odor. Our deep cleaning shampoo ensures a thorough clean, revitalizing your carpets and leaving them fresh and clean. With our expertise and state-of-the-art equipment, we guarantee that our deep cleaning shampoo delivers the best way to clean carpets.
Rinsing and Extraction
Rinsing and extraction are crucial steps in our carpet shampooing process, ensuring the removal of cleaning agents, residue and contaminants from your carpets. Our professional carpet cleaner thoroughly rinses your carpets, which eliminates any traces of shampoo and leaves them clean, fresh and residue-free. Then, the extraction process takes place, effectively removing any remaining dirt, allergens and odor to achieve a deep clean.
Final Inspection and Client Approval
At The Heiser Group, customer satisfaction is our top priority. That's why our carpet shampooing process concludes with a final inspection and client approval. Our trained technicians thoroughly inspect your carpets, ensuring that every aspect of our cleaning process has been completed successfully. We want to make sure that you are completely satisfied with our service, and we invite you to review the last test results and provide feedback. Your approval is our guarantee that our professional carpet shampooing process has met our commitment to quality.
Our Expertise in Carpet Shampooing
When you choose The Heiser Group for your carpet shampooing needs, you can trust that your carpets are in good hands.
Efficient Tools and Techniques
We use top-of-the-line equipment to ensure a thorough and efficient clean. Our carpet cleaning machine is designed to effectively remove dirt, stains and odor, leaving your carpets clean and revitalized. Our efficient tools and cleaning techniques provide a deep, effective clean.
Commitment to Quality Service
Our commitment to quality service is at the core of everything we do. It is reflected in our professional team who is dedicated to providing the best carpet cleaning experience for our clients. It is also reflected in our use of only the best quality cleaning products and equipment, ensuring a deep clean that exceeds expectations.
Customer Satisfaction
We take pride in our work and always ensure that our clients are completely satisfied with our service. When you choose The Heiser Group, you can trust that we will deliver exceptional results, leaving your carpets looking their best.
Flexible Schedules
We understand that convenience is an important factor when it comes to choosing a carpet shampooing service. That's why we offer flexible scheduling options, so you can choose a time that works best for you. Our reliable team will ensure that your carpet cleaning service is completed on time.

metadata.title: How to Fight Mold and Mildew in Your Home or Office
metadata.description: Everyone has encountered mold or mildew, whether it be some fruit left out too long or a cup of water forgotten somewhere in your home or office. Most of the time, the issue can be dealt with by ridding your home of the fungi, but in some cases, the problem has roots that go deeper than rotten food.Mold and mildew can produce extreme hazards for your health, so it’s vital to not only how to spot them from sprouting up, but how to prevent them altogether.

text:
How to Fight Mold and Mildew in Your Home or Office
How to Fight Mold and Mildew in Your Home or Office
Everyone has encountered mold or mildew, whether it be some fruit left out too long or a cup of water forgotten somewhere in your home or office. Most of the time, the issue can be dealt with by ridding your home of the fungi, but in some cases, the problem has roots that go deeper than rotten food.
Mold and mildew can produce extreme hazards for your health, so it’s vital to not only how to spot them from sprouting up, but how to prevent them altogether.
The Hazards of Mold and Mildew
Molds tend to be a fact of life in your home, in your office; anywhere that you might find moisture there is mold. While some people are more sensitive to mold than others, all of us will suffer health detriments from too much exposure.
Too much exposure to mold or mildew can cause:
Nasal Stiffness
Throat Irritation
Cough
Eye irritation
Skin Irritation
Mold in the home tends to be the biggest cause of mold or mildew related illness primarily because of the close proximity and length of exposure.
Generally, home-based mold tends to grow in places with a lot of moisture, such as the kitchen, bathrooms. Leaky roofs, windows, or pipes are also places where it’s commonly found, though it can grow almost anywhere.
The Difference Between Mold and Mildew
Mold and mildew are commonly used interchangeably, and that’s for good reason: Mildew is a type of mold, though there are differences between the two.
Mold: A type of green, black, or white fungi that grow indoors or outdoors and in warm, damp areas. Mold is typically, much more harmful than mildew.
Mildew: Mildew is a flat, thin layer of black or grey fungal growth that tends to appear on fabrics, carpets, and upholstery. It thrives on warm, moist surfaces.
Fighting Mold and Mildew
Fighting mold in your home or office is a big key to maintaining a healthy lifestyle for everyone.
To control mold growth before it occurs, you should:
Control the humidity levels.
Don’t allow leaky roofs, windows, or pipes to go unfixed for long periods of time.
Ventilate any warm, moist parts of your home like showers, laundry, or sinks.
If you’ve found a mold problem, remember that not only do you need to defeat the mold, but you need to fix whatever was causing it.
There are a few ways you can kill mold, including many store-bought chemical solutions and some home remedies. Household staples—like vinegar and baking soda—are quick fixes, but if you need something stronger, you should consult a guide to ensure safe practice.
Mold and mildew are unwanted nuisances in the home and office that, with the right preparation and tools, can be prevented and destroyed.
If attempting to tackle it yourself doesn’t work, call in the experts at The Heiser Group. With over four decades of experience, we’ll ensure that you can live in a mold and mildew-free environment.
‍
markdown:
# How to Fight Mold and Mildew in Your Home or Office

## How to Fight Mold and Mildew in Your Home or Office

Everyone has encountered mold or mildew, whether it be some fruit left out too long or a cup of water forgotten somewhere in your home or office. Most of the time, the issue can be dealt with by ridding your home of the fungi, but in some cases, the problem has roots that go deeper than rotten food.

Mold and mildew can produce extreme hazards for your health, so it’s vital to not only how to spot them from sprouting up, but how to prevent them altogether.

## The Hazards of Mold and Mildew

Molds tend to be a fact of life in your home, in your office; [anywhere that you might find moisture there is mold.](https://www.cdc.gov/mold/faqs.htm) While some people are more sensitive to mold than others, all of us will suffer health detriments from too much exposure.

**Too much exposure to mold or mildew can cause:**

*   Nasal Stiffness
*   Throat Irritation
*   Cough
*   Eye irritation
*   Skin Irritation

Mold in the home tends to be the biggest cause of mold or mildew related illness primarily because of the close proximity and length of exposure.

Generally, home-based mold tends to grow in places with a lot of moisture, such as the kitchen, bathrooms. Leaky roofs, windows, or pipes are also places where it’s commonly found, [though it can grow almost anywhere.](https://www.cdc.gov/mold/faqs.htm)

## The Difference Between Mold and Mildew

Mold and mildew are commonly used interchangeably, and that’s for good reason: [Mildew is a type of mold](https://restorationmasterfinder.com/restoration/difference-between-mold-and-mildew/), though there are differences between the two.

[**Mold:**](https://www.cdc.gov/mold/faqs.htm) A type of green, black, or white fungi that grow indoors or outdoors and in warm, damp areas. Mold is typically, much more harmful than mildew.

[**Mildew:**](https://restorationmasterfinder.com/restoration/difference-between-mold-and-mildew/) Mildew is a flat, thin layer of black or grey fungal growth that tends to appear on fabrics, carpets, and upholstery. It thrives on warm, moist surfaces.

## Fighting Mold and Mildew

Fighting mold in your home or office is a big key to maintaining a healthy lifestyle for everyone.

To [control mold growth before it occurs](https://www.cdc.gov/mold/faqs.htm), you should:

*   Control the humidity levels.
*   Don’t allow leaky roofs, windows, or pipes to go unfixed for long periods of time.
*   Ventilate any warm, moist parts of your home like showers, laundry, or sinks.

If you’ve found a mold problem, remember that not only do you need to defeat the mold, but you need to fix whatever was causing it.

There are a few ways you can kill mold, including many store-bought chemical solutions and some home remedies. Household staples—like vinegar and baking soda—are quick fixes, but if you need something stronger, you should [consult a guide](https://www.epa.gov/mold/mold-remediation-schools-and-commercial-buildings-guide?fbclid=IwAR26eHIZIHR2SroIKhVzv7nunbpajJWm8VAa__4AER3jCAZQLiNm99K7SOU) to ensure safe practice.

Mold and mildew are unwanted nuisances in the home and office that, with the right preparation and tools, can be prevented and destroyed.

If attempting to tackle it yourself doesn’t work, [call in the experts at The Heiser Group](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact). With over four decades of experience, we’ll ensure that you can live in a mold and mildew-free environment.

‍

metadata.title: Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays for Gyms
metadata.description: Electrostatic disinfectant spray has become a game-changer for gyms and fitness centers. With every company looking for ways to safely allow their customers and members back, gyms have found it particularly tough. So tough that staples in the industry, like Gold’s Gym, are being forced to file for bankruptcy. When patrons are covered in sweat and touching every piece of equipment, what can be done to disinfect the gym environment safely and quickly? Many gyms are turning to electrostatic disinfection as the answer.

text:
Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays for Gyms
Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray for Gyms
Electrostatic disinfectant spray has become a game-changer for gyms and fitness centers.
With every company looking for ways to safely allow their customers and members back, gyms have found it particularly tough. So tough that staples in the industry, like Gold’s Gym, are being forced to file for bankruptcy. 
When patrons are covered in sweat and touching every piece of equipment, what can be done to disinfect the gym environment safely and quickly? Many gyms are turning to electrostatic disinfection as the answer.
Safe Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
With electrostatic disinfection, gym staff can safely and quickly disinfect large areas of the gym. A sweep of facilities like showers, locker rooms, backrooms, sauna’s, and more can now be cleaned top-to-bottom without spending hours and hours wiping everything from floor to ceiling.
The same goes for the gym equipment such as racks, weights, and all types of machines. Rather than meticulously disinfecting every surface that gets touched by gym members, a full spraying of the equipment can fully disinfect.
Thorough Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
Another huge benefit of electrostatic disinfection is that, as they leave the nozzle, the spray is electrostatically charged which means the disinfectant clings to and completely covers all surfaces they come into contact with. That means all of the hard-to-reach parts of gym equipment that could get passed over during a standard cleaning process.
Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Offers Another Line of Defense
Many gyms now offer their members lots of options to help keep the gyms clean: access to disinfectant wipes, sprays, hand washing stations, sanitizer, and more. But, you cannot rely on everyone else to keep your equipment from transmitting diseases and viruses. 
Offering a full disinfection is another line of defense against infection and will help instill a sense of safety and trust from your customers and members.
Gyms have become a large talking point for health and safety during this crisis and many have failed to find adequate solutions that allow for the return of their members. But, electrostatic disinfection provides a safe solution that will keep gyms clean, healthy, and open.
To schedule a walkthrough of your fitness center, reach out to the electrostatic disinfectant spray specialists at The Heiser Group.

# Electrostatic Disinfectant Sprays for Gyms

## Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray for Gyms

Electrostatic disinfectant spray has become a game-changer for gyms and fitness centers.

With every company looking for ways to safely allow their customers and members back, gyms have found it particularly tough. So tough that staples in the industry, like Gold’s Gym, are being forced to file for bankruptcy.

When patrons are covered in sweat and touching every piece of equipment, what can be done to disinfect the gym environment safely and quickly? Many gyms are turning to electrostatic disinfection as the answer.

## Safe Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray

With electrostatic disinfection, gym staff can safely and quickly disinfect large areas of the gym. A sweep of facilities like showers, locker rooms, backrooms, sauna’s, and more can now be cleaned top-to-bottom without spending hours and hours wiping everything from floor to ceiling.

The same goes for the gym equipment such as racks, weights, and all types of machines. Rather than meticulously disinfecting every surface that gets touched by gym members, a full spraying of the equipment can fully disinfect.

## Thorough Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray

Another huge benefit of electrostatic disinfection is that, as they leave the nozzle, the spray is electrostatically charged which means the disinfectant clings to and completely covers all surfaces they come into contact with. That means all of the hard-to-reach parts of gym equipment that could get passed over during a standard cleaning process.

## Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Offers Another Line of Defense

Many gyms now offer their members [lots of options to help keep the gyms clean](https://blog.nasm.org/how-to-clean-your-gym): access to disinfectant wipes, sprays, hand washing stations, sanitizer, and more. But, you cannot rely on everyone else to keep your equipment from transmitting diseases and viruses.

Offering a full disinfection is another line of defense against infection and will help instill a sense of safety and trust from your customers and members.

Gyms have become a large talking point for health and safety during this crisis and many have failed to find adequate solutions that allow for the return of their members. But, electrostatic disinfection provides a safe solution that will keep gyms clean, healthy, and open.

To schedule a walkthrough of your fitness center, [**reach out to the electrostatic disinfectant spray specialists at The Heiser Group.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: How to Keep Your Office Clean of Coronavirus
metadata.description: Coronavirus is spreading quickly throughout the entire world with new cases popping up daily. Fortunately, the CDC and other health organizations have provided many tips to help offices stay clean of the virus and limit its spread.

text:
How to Keep Your Office Clean of Coronavirus
How to Keep Your Office Clean of Coronavirus
Coronavirus is spreading quickly throughout the entire world with new cases popping up daily. Fortunately, the CDC and other health organizations have provided many tips to help offices stay clean of the virus and limit its spread.
KEEP YOUR PERSONAL AREA CLEAN
The first step toward a consistently clean office is to take care of your space. Here are some basic tips on maintaining a sanitized work area:
Frequently sanitize your equipment. The equipment you use most often, such as keyboards, phones, mouse, pens and pencils, and your desk are the ones most susceptible to germs.
Keep hand sanitizer close by. It’s worth your time to invest in a large bottle of sanitizer exclusively for yourself.
Have tissues on your desk. Using tissues when sneezing helps trap mucus and germs from flying about. If no tissues are available, the “Dracula sneeze technique” is your best option (sneezing into the crook of your elbow).
SANITIZE SURFACES THAT ARE FREQUENTLY TOUCHED
In order to halt the virus before it can begin to spread throughout your office, sanitize the surfaces that are frequently touched by everyone.
This includes:
Doorknobs
Office equipment like printers, copiers, coffee machines, water coolers, etc.
Handles of cabinets and drawers
Countertops
Kitchen appliances like fridges, microwaves, toaster ovens, etc.
This can be as simple as wiping them down hourly with disinfectant wipes or having a container of wipes for people to use when touching these surfaces. And when nearly everyone in the office is touching these objects, sanitizing them is a smart long-term practice.
ENCOURAGE PEOPLE TO WASH THEIR HANDS
This may sound like common sense, but actually 95% aren’t washing their hands properly.
Your employees’ personal hygiene is one of the biggest keys to keeping coronavirus away which is why it’s important to educate and encourage people about proper handwashing techniques. According to the CDC, proper technique involves:
Running hands under clean water (warm or cold).
Lathering hands with soap.
Rub hands together for at least 20 seconds.
Rinse with clean water.
Dry completely.
When handwashing is not something you have the ability or time to do frequently, hand sanitizer can be helpful, but be sure it contains 60-95% alcohol.
RALLY AND INFORM YOUR TEAM
The fight against the virus shouldn’t be left to just one person. The most effective strategy is to enlist the help of everyone by informing those around you of best practices, providing them with the proper equipment (wipes, cleaners, paper towels, hand sanitizer, face masks, etc.), and making sure everyone does their part in keeping the office clean. As we said above, everyone needs to pull their weight, keep their things clean, and pitch in by sanitizing frequently touched surfaces.
Along with that, you may refrain from basic business etiquette like hand shaking for the time being.
Also, be sure everyone understands the basic symptoms of the virus which, according to the CDC, are fever, cough, and shortness of breath. If someone shows signs of the virus, ensure they don’t come in and risk the health of everyone else.
It will take your whole team to ensure the office stays as clean as possible and as safe as possible from the coronavirus. Everyone needs to be informed and everyone needs to clean. With the right strategy, the right tools, and the right mindset, you can keep yourself and your team healthy.
But ensuring a properly cleaned and sanitized office is time-consuming, to say the least. For those looking to permanently take this operation off their plate, call in the commercial cleaning experts at The Heiser Group.
