markdown:
# How to Keep Your Office Clean of Coronavirus

## How to Keep Your Office Clean of Coronavirus

Coronavirus is spreading quickly throughout the entire world with new cases popping up daily. Fortunately, the CDC and other health organizations have provided many tips to help offices stay clean of the virus and limit its spread.

## KEEP YOUR PERSONAL AREA CLEAN

The first step toward a consistently clean office is to [take care of your space](https://www.shrm.org/resourcesandtools/legal-and-compliance/employment-law/pages/keep-your-workplace-clean-during-coronavirus-scare.aspx). Here are some basic tips on maintaining a sanitized work area:

1.  **Frequently sanitize your equipment**. The equipment you use most often, such as keyboards, phones, mouse, pens and pencils, and your desk are the ones most susceptible to germs.
2.  **Keep hand sanitizer close by**. It’s worth your time to invest in a large bottle of sanitizer exclusively for yourself.
3.  **Have tissues on your desk.** Using tissues when sneezing helps trap mucus and germs from flying about. If no tissues are available, the “Dracula sneeze technique” is your best option (sneezing into the crook of your elbow).

## SANITIZE SURFACES THAT ARE FREQUENTLY TOUCHED

In order to halt the virus before it can begin to spread throughout your office, [sanitize the surfaces that are frequently touched by everyone](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/home/cleaning-disinfection.html).

**This includes:**

*   Doorknobs
*   Office equipment like printers, copiers, coffee machines, water coolers, etc.
*   Handles of cabinets and drawers
*   Countertops
*   Kitchen appliances like fridges, microwaves, toaster ovens, etc.

This can be as simple as wiping them down hourly with disinfectant wipes or having a container of wipes for people to use when touching these surfaces. And when nearly everyone in the office is touching these objects, sanitizing them is a smart long-term practice.

## ENCOURAGE PEOPLE TO WASH THEIR HANDS

This may sound like common sense, but actually [95% aren’t washing their hands properly](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/95-percent-of-people-wash-their-hands-improperly-are-you-one-of-them/).

Your employees’ personal hygiene is one of the biggest keys to keeping coronavirus away which is why it’s important to educate and encourage people about proper handwashing techniques. [According to the CDC, proper technique involves:](https://www.health.com/condition/infectious-diseases/how-to-wash-your-hands)

1.  Running hands under clean water (warm or cold).
2.  Lathering hands with soap.
3.  Rub hands together for **at least 20 seconds.**
4.  Rinse with clean water.
5.  Dry completely.

When handwashing is not something you have the ability or time to do frequently, hand sanitizer can be helpful, but be sure it contains 60-95% alcohol.

## RALLY AND INFORM YOUR TEAM

The fight against the virus shouldn’t be left to just one person. The most effective strategy is to enlist the help of everyone by informing those around you of best practices, providing them with the proper equipment (wipes, cleaners, paper towels, hand sanitizer, face masks, etc.), and making sure everyone does their part in keeping the office clean. As we said above, everyone needs to pull their weight, keep their things clean, and pitch in by sanitizing frequently touched surfaces.

Along with that, you may [refrain from basic business etiquette like hand shaking](https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2020/03/coronavirus-what-you-can-do-help-slow-outbreak/607369/) for the time being.

Also, be sure everyone understands the basic symptoms of the virus which, [according to the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/symptoms.html), are fever, cough, and shortness of breath. If someone shows signs of the virus, ensure they don’t come in and risk the health of everyone else.

It will take your whole team to ensure the office stays as clean as possible and as safe as possible from the coronavirus. Everyone needs to be informed and everyone needs to clean. With the right strategy, the right tools, and the right mindset, you can keep yourself and your team healthy.

But ensuring a properly cleaned and sanitized office is time-consuming, to say the least. For those looking to permanently take this operation off their plate, [**call in the commercial cleaning experts at The Heiser Group**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact).

‍

metadata.title: Fall Home Cleaning
metadata.description: With summer gone, it is time to prepare for fall home cleaning! Summer is the busiest season for many and that means lots of dirt, grime, and dust buildup in places you do not normally reach with a weekly or daily cleaning.Here is a list of things to remember to help you get ready for the fall.

text:
Fall Home Cleaning
Fall Home Cleaning
With summer gone, it is time to prepare for fall home cleaning! Summer is the busiest season for many and that means lots of dirt, grime, and dust buildup in places you do not normally reach with a weekly or daily cleaning.
Here is a list of things to remember to help you get ready for the fall.
Fall Home Cleaning Tip #1: Remember Your Baseboards
Summer is typically the busiest month for many with family and friends constantly coming and going. This increase in foot traffic tends to lead toward the buildup of dust and muck on the baseboards around your home. 
To clean them off, use a dusting cloth to get the surface dust followed by a damp rag or paper towel to scrub away the grime.
Fall Home Cleaning Tip #2: Protect Your Floors from Mud
With fall weather comes rain, snow, and typically lots of mud which can track into your home and quickly cake on, making a difficult-to-clean mess. To prepare, there are a few things you should consider protecting the interior of your home.
Prepare Your Entryways: You might want to consider laying down mats and rugs right inside doorways and have a place for people to place shoes, boots, etc., so they do not wear them into the home.
Mop Regularly: It is a fact of life that dirt and mud will track in at some point. So, you must mop regularly, especially near doorways, to make sure dirt does not cake on and build-up to create something difficult to remove.
Fall Home Cleaning Tip #3: Clean Windows & Screens
Between the bugs, pollen, and dirt of the summer months, your windows and window screens are most likely full of dirt and grime.
For windows, a simple store-bought cleaning mixture and some paper towels should do the trick to relieve them of the dust and grime buildup over the summer.
To clean your screens, the most effective way is to remove them completely and follow these steps:
After removing, you will probably want to take them outside so the dust and dirt cleaned off does not build up back inside your home.
Next, vacuum the loose dust off of them with either a handheld vacuum or a handheld attachment.
Then, use soapy water and wipe them off with a rag or towel. After that, you can rinse them off simply with a hose or by wiping them again with clean water.
One more round of vacuuming to dry and pick up any looser articles from the screens.
Screens can quickly collect all kinds of dirt over just a few months, especially after a long summer, so it is important to give them a quick cleaning in the fall.
Fall Home Cleaning Tip #4: Clean Out Chimneys and Fireplaces
Fall is the perfect time of year to hang out by the fire while the temperatures drop outside. But, before you start building a fire, make sure you have cleaned the fireplace. You need to make sure all loose soot and debris are cleared out and that you have removed and cleaned all grates and andirons.
After that, you will want to scrub the walls with a hard-bristled brush to remove the soot and grime that may have built up over the months it was not in use. Be sure to cover the bottom of the fireplace with a newspaper or something to catch the falling debris.
Fall Home Cleaning Tip #5: Clear Out Your Gutters
Fall is a difficult time for the gutters on your home. With a mixture of falling leaves, rainwater, snow, hail, and freezing temperatures all possible, your gutters will be working hard. Make sure you clean them thoroughly at the beginning of the season to make sure they are in fighting shape to battle the elements and do their jobs.
Here are a few tips to help you give them the best possible cleaning:
Use a ‘gutter scoop’ or another small scoop to get the debris out from inside. Make sure to clear all the spaces so water can flow smoothly. 
Flush your gutters with a garden hose to clear out hidden debris and to make sure water can get through every pipe. 
Lastly, do a visual inspection to make sure you do not have any loose or sagging metals. You can also take a look at any weather damage from the summer storms.
Fall is the perfect time to do a quick deep cleaning to clean out the dust and grime from summer and prepare your home for the approaching cold weather months. 
To prepare your home for fall, get in touch with the home cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.
‍
markdown:
# Fall Home Cleaning

## Fall Home Cleaning

With summer gone, it is time to prepare for fall home cleaning! Summer is the busiest season for many and that means lots of dirt, grime, and dust buildup in places you do not normally reach with a weekly or daily cleaning.

Here is a list of things to remember to help you get ready for the fall.

## Fall Home Cleaning Tip #1: Remember Your Baseboards

Summer is typically the busiest month for many with family and friends constantly coming and going. This increase in foot traffic tends to lead toward the buildup of dust and muck on the baseboards around your home.

To clean them off, use a dusting cloth to get the surface dust followed by a damp rag or paper towel to scrub away the grime.

## Fall Home Cleaning Tip #2: Protect Your Floors from Mud

With fall weather comes rain, snow, and typically lots of mud which can track into your home and quickly cake on, making a difficult-to-clean mess. To prepare, there are a few things you should consider protecting the interior of your home.

**Prepare Your Entryways:** You might want to consider laying down mats and rugs right inside doorways and have a place for people to place shoes, boots, etc., so they do not wear them into the home.

**Mop Regularly:** It is a fact of life that dirt and mud will track in at some point. So, you must mop regularly, especially near doorways, to make sure dirt does not cake on and build-up to create something difficult to remove.

## Fall Home Cleaning Tip #3: Clean Windows & Screens

Between the bugs, pollen, and dirt of the summer months, your windows and window screens are most likely full of dirt and grime.

For windows, a simple store-bought cleaning mixture and some paper towels should do the trick to relieve them of the dust and grime buildup over the summer.

To clean your screens, [the most effective way](https://www.diynetwork.com/how-to/maintenance-and-repair/cleaning/how-to-wash-screen-windows-and-doors) is to remove them completely and follow these steps:

*   After removing, you will probably want to take them outside so the dust and dirt cleaned off does not build up back inside your home.

*   Next, vacuum the loose dust off of them with either a handheld vacuum or a handheld attachment.

*   Then, use soapy water and wipe them off with a rag or towel. After that, you can rinse them off simply with a hose or by wiping them again with clean water.

*   One more round of vacuuming to dry and pick up any looser articles from the screens.

Screens can quickly collect all kinds of dirt over just a few months, especially after a long summer, so it is important to give them a quick cleaning in the fall.

## Fall Home Cleaning Tip #4: Clean Out Chimneys and Fireplaces

Fall is the perfect time of year to hang out by the fire while the temperatures drop outside. But, before you start building a fire, make sure you have cleaned the fireplace. You need to make sure all loose soot and debris are cleared out and that you have removed and cleaned all grates and andirons.

After that, you will want to scrub the walls with a hard-bristled brush to remove the soot and grime that may have built up over the months it was not in use. Be sure to cover the bottom of the fireplace with a newspaper or something to catch the falling debris.

## Fall Home Cleaning Tip #5: Clear Out Your Gutters

Fall is a difficult time for the gutters on your home. With a mixture of falling leaves, rainwater, snow, hail, and freezing temperatures all possible, your gutters will be working hard. Make sure you clean them thoroughly at the beginning of the season to make sure they are in fighting shape to battle the elements and do their jobs.

Here are a few tips to help you give them the best possible cleaning:

*   Use a ‘gutter scoop’ or another small scoop to get the debris out from inside. Make sure to clear all the spaces so water can flow smoothly.
*   Flush your gutters with a garden hose to clear out hidden debris and to make sure water can get through every pipe.
*   Lastly, do a visual inspection to make sure you do not have any loose or sagging metals. You can also take a look at any weather damage from the summer storms.

Fall is the perfect time to do a quick deep cleaning to clean out the dust and grime from summer and prepare your home for the approaching cold weather months.

To prepare your home for fall, [**get in touch with the home cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: How Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Stacks Up to the Alternatives
metadata.description: Electrostatic Disinfectant sprays are the latest advancement in cleaning technology and are quickly becoming a mainstay in the arsenal of cleaners everywhere. They’re efficient, effective, and—compared to the competition—the best way to disinfect a large area.

text:
How Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Stacks Up to the Alternatives
How Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Stacks Up to the Alternatives
Electrostatic Disinfectant sprays are the latest advancement in cleaning technology and are quickly becoming a mainstay in the arsenal of cleaners everywhere. They’re efficient, effective, and—compared to the competition—the best way to disinfect a large area.
HOW ELECTROSTATIC DISINFECTANT SPRAY COMPARES
There are many ways to get the disinfecting job done when looking to clean industrial areas or spaces with lots of traffic like locker rooms. Each option will do the job, if done well, but not all of them are easy or efficient. Here’s how electrostatic disinfectant spray stacks up compared to some of the top alternative cleaning methods.
Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Fogging
Though some foggers can be electrostatically charged, handling your charged spray with a handheld sprayer gives you the accuracy to ensure that all areas are hit and disinfected properly.
A handheld sprayer gives you full control over where and how much disinfectant you apply to certain areas and leaves no mystery as to whether all the surfaces and areas were affected. 
Fogging a room is a good way to hit a large area with little effort, but it does leave you potentially spotty coverage, something you don’t have to worry about with electrostatic spraying.
Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Ultraviolet Light
Though using an ultraviolet source is effective at disinfecting and can be used in a handheld fashion much like electrostatic, the real drawback comes from the price of application. The equipment can be expensive to purchase and expensive to run.
While you get a solid, contactless solution, it’s also probably the most expensive one whereas using electrostatic disinfectant spraying is cheaper while still providing a huge amount of coverage with the same amount of effort.
Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Manual Disinfection
The benefits of electrostatic disinfectants over a manual-style disinfection are abundant. Not only does using an electrostatic sprayer save you time, it is a much more efficient way at making sure every surface is effectively covered and disinfected. 
The electrostatically charged particles involved in electrostatic disinfection wrap themselves around every surface, leaving nothing untouched and removing any risk of you accidentally forgoing an area or missing anything.
Comparing electrostatic disinfectant spray to the many other types of disinfectants just makes all the benefits even more glaring. It is an efficient, effective, and price-friendly way to disinfect any area and ensure all surfaces are treated evenly.
For help with commercial cleaning, get in touch with the electrostatic disinfectant spraying specialists over at The Heiser Group.

markdown:
# How Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Stacks Up to the Alternatives

## How Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray Stacks Up to the Alternatives

Electrostatic Disinfectant sprays are the latest advancement in cleaning technology and are quickly becoming a mainstay in the arsenal of cleaners everywhere. They’re efficient, effective, and—[compared to the competition](https://www.cleanroomtechnology.com/news/article_page/Cleaning_and_Disinfection_Whole_room_fogging/52850)—the best way to disinfect a large area.

## HOW ELECTROSTATIC DISINFECTANT SPRAY COMPARES

There are many ways to get the disinfecting job done when looking to clean industrial areas or spaces with lots of traffic like locker rooms. Each option will do the job, if done well, but not all of them are easy or efficient. Here’s how electrostatic disinfectant spray stacks up compared to some of the top alternative cleaning methods.

## Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Fogging

Though some foggers can be electrostatically charged, handling your charged spray with a handheld sprayer gives you the accuracy to ensure that all areas are hit and disinfected properly.

A handheld sprayer gives you full control over where and how much disinfectant you apply to certain areas and leaves no mystery as to whether all the surfaces and areas were affected.

Fogging a room is a good way to hit a large area with little effort, but it does leave you [potentially spotty coverage](https://efsclean.com/uncategorized/electrostatic-disinfecting-versus-fogging-whats-the-difference/), something you don’t have to worry about with electrostatic spraying.

## Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Ultraviolet Light

Though using an ultraviolet source is effective at disinfecting and can be used in a handheld fashion much like electrostatic, the real drawback comes from the price of application. The equipment can be expensive to purchase and expensive to run.

While you get a solid, contactless solution, it’s also [probably the most expensive](https://www.core77.com/posts/96010/The-Benefits-and-Drawbacks-of-Disinfecting-Surfaces-and-Killing-COVID-19-with-UV-Lights) one whereas using electrostatic disinfectant spraying is cheaper while still providing a huge amount of coverage with the same amount of effort.

## Electrostatic Disinfectant Vs. Manual Disinfection

The benefits of electrostatic disinfectants over a manual-style disinfection are abundant. Not only does using an electrostatic sprayer save you time, it is a much more efficient way at making sure every surface is effectively covered and disinfected.

The electrostatically charged particles involved in electrostatic disinfection wrap themselves around every surface, leaving nothing untouched and removing any risk of you accidentally forgoing an area or missing anything.

Comparing electrostatic disinfectant spray to the many other types of disinfectants just makes all the benefits even more glaring. It is an efficient, effective, and price-friendly way to disinfect any area and ensure all surfaces are treated evenly.

For help with commercial cleaning, [get in touch with the electrostatic disinfectant spraying specialists over at The Heiser Group.](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: Entice Home Buyers with a Realty Cleaning
metadata.description: Selling a home is hard. You want to make sure you have as many advantages as possible when it comes time to start listing and showing your home. One thing you should absolutely consider is professionally cleaning your home before you show it off to potential home buyers. A professional realty cleaning will give you a leg up right off the bat and provide many benefits to help you on your way to a selling your property.

text:
Entice Home Buyers with a Realty Cleaning
Entice Home Buyers with a Realty Cleaning
Selling a home is hard. You want to make sure you have as many advantages as possible when it comes time to start listing and showing your home.
One thing you should absolutely consider is professionally cleaning your home before you show it off to potential home buyers. A professional realty cleaning will give you a leg up right off the bat and provide many benefits to help you on your way to a selling your property.
REALTY CLEANINGS IMPROVE FIRST IMPRESSIONS
A clean home providers a much friendlier first impression than a dirty one. This is the number one reason why homeowners rely on realty cleaning companies like The Heiser Group. The last thing you want is for a potential buyer to enter your home with lingering smells, dirty walls, stained carpets, dirty glass, and dusty surfaces.
When home buyers see dirt and grime, that’s all they can think about and that picture will linger in their minds long after the tour and into their decision making process. Cleaning is a surefire way to make sure they’re able to see the house for its best features and show that it’s a well-maintained property.
LET YOUR HOME BUYERS VIEW IT AS THEIR OWN
One of the most important parts of selling is to allow your potential buyers to picture the home as their own. That means you need to provide them with a blank canvas so they can imagine their own things, their own family when they walk through.
Deep cleaning a home before listing and touring it is the best way to do that. When you thoroughly clean a home before selling, you’re literally wiping away anything that’s standing in the way of your potential buyer seeing it as anything but their own.
MAKE YOUR HOME MOVE-IN READY
A clean home gives off that coveted “move-in ready” vibe that homebuyers love. When they walk into a home that’s already spotless and clear of clutter, it makes the moving process seem so much easier when all they need to do is start moving in their furniture without having to worry about erasing any signs of past owners.
Conducting a deep cleaning before listing your home for sale is a major advantage you can give yourself over your competition.
To have your home professionally cleaned, reach out to the realty cleaning specialists at The Heiser Group.

metadata.title: Combat COVID with Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
metadata.description: As businesses look for ways to stay open during the pandemic, many have begun using electrostatic disinfectant spray to combat COVID, clean facilities, and ensure the safety of their guests and customers. Here are a few of the industries taking advantage of this breakthrough in cleaning technology.

text:
Combat COVID with Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
Combat COVID with Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
As businesses look for ways to stay open during the pandemic, many have begun using electrostatic disinfectant spray to combat COVID, clean facilities, and ensure the safety of their guests and customers.
Here are a few of the industries taking advantage of this breakthrough in cleaning technology.
1. Gyms and Athletic Clubs
Gyms and athletic clubs have struggled to find efficient solutions to providing a safe place to work out. In a place where bodily fluids are abundant, they could not rely on customers cleaning machines and hand washing locker rooms and showers.
So, they turned to electrostatic disinfectant spray because it is the quickest way to cover a lot of ground. Suddenly cleaning an entire locker room was fast and incredibly efficient. Thanks to its quick drying nature and its ability to cling to surfaces, cleaning machines became much easier and much more effective.
2. Airlines
With hundreds of customers going in, out, and around an airplane every few hours, finding a cleaning solution for airlines was a necessity—especially with the small amount of time between flights and trying to keep people from waiting a long time between flights.
Electrostatic disinfectant spray allows for one quick and clean sweep of a plane that finds every nook and cranny of a seat and fold-out tray while drying quickly enough to allow the next batch of passengers to board without waiting.
3. Schools
Schools see a lot of traffic every day from the students, teachers, faculty, and visitors. And they also have a huge number of public facilities to clean. This means that there just is not time to hand wash every single one each day. With locker rooms, bathrooms, classrooms, hallways, cafeterias, gyms, and offices, they needed a quicker answer.
Electrostatic disinfectant spray was the solution, allowing school cleaners to cover more ground quicker, not to mention a better, full coverage cleaning.
4. Business and Office Buildings
While many of us continue to work from home, there are just as many who simply do not have that option and office buildings have had to find a way to ensure their health and safety. Many of these buildings have turned to electrostatic disinfectants to clean bathrooms, elevators, and common areas.
They can do this because of how much time electrostatic disinfectant saves and how quickly it goes into effect.
5. Entertainment
Entertainment companies from all angles—movie theaters, theme parks, arcades, sports clubs—desperately searched for an effective way to clean their massive facilities. Electrostatic disinfectant allowed them not only the ability to clean a room as big as an IMAX theater, but also allowed them to finally re-open.
Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray has become a mainstay in a huge variety of industries because of all the benefits it provides to cleaning large areas quickly and effectively.

metadata.title: Top 5 Tools You Need to Maintain a Clean Office
metadata.description: When keeping a healthy and clean office, there are a few key items you’ll want in your cleaning arsenal in order to be prepared for any mess in any situation.Having these top 5 tools will go a long way in helping you to maintain a clean office.

text:
Top 5 Tools You Need to Maintain a Clean Office
Top 5 Tools You Need to Maintain a Clean Office
When keeping a healthy and clean office, there are a few key items you’ll want in your cleaning arsenal in order to be prepared for any mess in any situation.
Having these top 5 tools will go a long way in helping you to maintain a clean office.
A GOOD VACUUM
Even if your office is mostly tile or hardwood, investing in at least one good vacuum can make most messes easy to clean up. Conducting a quick vacuuming on a weekly basis will keep the floor free of crumbs, dust, and other debris.
DISINFECTANTS
A well-kept supply of disinfectants is important to maintain a healthy office environment for everyone at work, especially when cold and flu season comes around. Keeping a strong supply of disinfectants allows you to promote cleanliness and sanitation in those often touched and crucial pieces of equipment like pens, pencils, keyboards, phones, and door handles.
Disinfectants come in many shapes and forms:
Disinfectant Wipes: A very versatile tool, wipes can be used on everything from cleaning up small spills to quickly and effectively disinfecting any surface of disease-spreading pathogens.
Hand Sanitizer: A mainstay for a healthy workforce, keeping some spare hand sanitizer around the office can keep sickness from spreading from one surface to another.
Disinfectant Spray: Sometimes, messes consume a larger surface area. For the messes that are too big for wipes, using a spray and paper towel can quickly disinfect large areas.
AN ALL-SURFACE CLEANER
Messes come in all shapes and sizes so you need a cleaner with just as much versatility. Going with an all-surface cleaner will let you clean off many surfaces.
DUSTING SUPPLIES
Often forgotten but just as important as anything else is remembering to dust around the office. Dust can become a cocktail of bacteria, germs, dead skin, and anything else that floats around the office. Investing in a quick Swiffer can make dusting easy but be sure to check all the hard-to-reach areas like high shelves or the space above cabinets.
MOPPING SUPPLIES
If your office has tile or wood flooring, you’ll want another option in floor cleaning besides the vacuum. One of the many types of mops, along with a safe cleaning solution, makes quick work of caked on messes and dirt.
If you’re working with hardwood at the office, make sure to go with a specific hardwood. This way, you can ensure that the finish is protected throughout consistent cleaning.
Some messes are too big to keep under control with mere weekly cleaning around the office. For these instances, it’s more effective to call in the professionals at The Heiser Group. Get in touch with the commercial cleaning specialists today for a complimentary estimate.

# Top 5 Tools You Need to Maintain a Clean Office

## Top 5 Tools You Need to Maintain a Clean Office

When keeping a healthy and clean office, there are a few key items you’ll want in your cleaning arsenal in order to be prepared for any mess in any situation.

**Having these top 5 tools will go a long way in helping you to maintain a clean office.**

## A GOOD VACUUM

Even if your office is mostly tile or hardwood, investing in at least one good vacuum can make most messes easy to clean up. Conducting a quick vacuuming on a weekly basis will keep the floor free of crumbs, dust, and other debris.

## DISINFECTANTS

[A well-kept supply of disinfectants is important to maintain a healthy office environment](https://woodard247.com/office-cleaning-supplies-checklist/) for everyone at work, especially when cold and flu season comes around. Keeping a strong supply of disinfectants allows you to promote cleanliness and sanitation in those often touched and crucial pieces of equipment like pens, pencils, keyboards, phones, and door handles.

Disinfectants come in many shapes and forms:

*   **Disinfectant Wipes:** A very versatile tool, wipes can be used on everything from cleaning up small spills to quickly and effectively disinfecting any surface of disease-spreading pathogens.
*   **Hand Sanitizer:** A mainstay for a healthy workforce, keeping some spare hand sanitizer around the office can keep sickness from spreading from one surface to another.
*   **Disinfectant Spray:** Sometimes, messes consume a larger surface area. For the messes that are too big for wipes, using a spray and paper towel can quickly disinfect large areas.

## AN ALL-SURFACE CLEANER

Messes come in all shapes and sizes so you need a [cleaner with just as much versatility](https://www.quill.com/content/index/resource-center/office-supplies/buying-guides/office-supplies-list/default.cshtml). Going with an all-surface cleaner will let you clean off many surfaces.

## DUSTING SUPPLIES

Often forgotten but just as important as anything else is remembering to dust around the office. Dust can become a cocktail of bacteria, germs, dead skin, and anything else that floats around the office. Investing in a quick Swiffer can make dusting easy but be sure to check all the hard-to-reach areas like high shelves or the space above cabinets.

## MOPPING SUPPLIES

If your office has tile or wood flooring, you’ll want another option in floor cleaning besides the vacuum. One of the many types of mops, along with a safe cleaning solution, makes quick work of caked on messes and dirt.

If you’re working with hardwood at the office, make sure to go with a specific hardwood. This way, you can ensure that the finish is protected throughout consistent cleaning.

Some messes are too big to keep under control with mere weekly cleaning around the office. For these instances, it’s more effective to call in the professionals at The Heiser Group. [**Get in touch with the commercial cleaning specialists today for a complimentary estimate.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

metadata.title: Cleaning Tips for Re-Opening Your Office Safely
metadata.description: As many people are coming back to work and to a little bit of normalcy, they are arriving at office spaces that are anything but normal. New protocols, cleaning plans, spacing, and much more are becoming an office norm and the CDC has presented a huge list of things to consider. One of them is how an office goes about its general cleaning practices. Now more than ever you’ll need everyone on your team to do their part to maintain a clean and safe office. Here are a few tips to help you build a strategy and keep your workers healthy.

text:
Cleaning Tips for Re-Opening Your Office Safely
Cleaning Tips for Re-Opening Your Office Safely
As many people are coming back to work and to a little bit of normalcy, they are arriving at office spaces that are anything but normal. New protocols, cleaning plans, spacing, and much more are becoming an office norm and the CDC has presented a huge list of things to consider.
One of them is how an office goes about its general cleaning practices. Now more than ever you’ll need everyone on your team to do their part to maintain a clean and safe office. Here are a few tips to help you build a strategy and keep your workers healthy.
DISINFECT AS OFTEN AS POSSIBLE
Obviously, you have heard it over and over in the past few months, but make sure everyone in your office space is disinfecting a lot. Especially public office features like refrigerators, microwaves, doorknobs, elevator buttons, cabinets, and anything else that will get used by nearly everyone on a daily basis.

# Cleaning Tips for Re-Opening Your Office Safely

## Cleaning Tips for Re-Opening Your Office Safely

As many people are coming back to work and to a little bit of normalcy, they are arriving at office spaces that are anything but normal. New protocols, cleaning plans, spacing, and much more are becoming an office norm and the [CDC has presented a huge list of things to consider.](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/office-buildings.html)

One of them is how an office goes about its general cleaning practices. Now more than ever you’ll need everyone on your team to do their part to [maintain a clean and safe office](https://robinpowered.com/blog/tips-office-safety/). Here are a few tips to help you build a strategy and keep your workers healthy.

## DISINFECT AS OFTEN AS POSSIBLE

Obviously, you have heard it over and over in the past few months, but make sure everyone in your office space is disinfecting a lot. Especially public office features like refrigerators, microwaves, doorknobs, elevator buttons, cabinets, and anything else that will get used by nearly everyone on a daily basis.

Do what you can to encourage your team to clean up after themselves and always be thinking about what they have touched and what they need to disinfect.

## PROVIDING TOOLS FOR EVERYDAY CLEANING

The best way to encourage your team to stay clean during this time is to make sure they have everything they need. This means providing tissues, face masks, disinfectants at their desks, plenty of options for washing hands, ample space between desks, and general access to the cleaning supplies they need.

A quick list of supplies you should have readily available would include:

*   Hand Sanitizer

*   Hand Soap

*   Disinfectant Wipes and Spray

*   Tissues
*   Face Masks
*   Cleaning Gloves
*   Paper towels

## HIRE A REGULAR CLEANING STAFF

In times like these, cleaning is not something you can put off as a once or twice a week occurrence and if everyone is not on board, certain tasks slip through the cracks and can put everyone at risk.

The [CDC recommends constant cleaning](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/disinfecting-building-facility.html) and the easiest way to do that is to hire a professional team to come in and regularly maintain the space. This way you have that coveted peace of mind that every time you and your co-workers come into the office, you are arriving at a safe and healthy space.

As we all get back to work, it is important to consider how you will need to change your cleaning plans and consider how to enlist the help of everyone at the office to keep things clean. But, when in doubt, it is always a good idea to bring in professionals to make sure everything is as safe as possible.

metadata.description: Fighting every type of bacteria and germ requires constant change and the latest and greatest innovations in cleaning technology. text:
The Cleaning Benefits of Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
The Cleaning Benefits of Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray
Fighting every type of bacteria and germ requires constant change and the latest and greatest innovations in cleaning technology. As of now, that means the use of electrostatic disinfectants and cordless, handheld sprayers that unleash its disinfecting prowess wherever needed.
With new tech comes new questions. Learning everything about electrostatic disinfectant cleaners and why this new advancement is such an effective tool is the key to maintaining a healthy and productive office environment.
WHAT EXACTLY DOES “ELECTROSTATIC” MEAN?
The classic, tried-and-true style of disinfecting usually means a rag and some sprays but—unless you are constantly cleaning your supplies—that usually just ends up spreading the germs and bacteria around.
With electrostatic disinfectants, you’re using a specialized solution—combined with air and atomized by an electrode inside the sprayer. Thanks to the combination of the solution and sprayer, the spray contains positively charged particles that are able to stick to and coat any surfaces and objects. This provides better coverage of large surfaces and a strong disinfectant solution.
WHY IT IS AN EFFECTIVE CLEANING SOLUTION
Electrostatic spray is—as the name suggests—electrically charged. This means that the appropriate sanitizers and disinfectants can fully wrap surfaces and completely clean them. No area is left untouched. Normal cleaners like sprays, wipes, and rags will spread germs around and it is easy to miss spots within, on top, or behind surfaces—where bacteria hides.
It is an efficient way to clean, also. Surfaces that are already covered will repel the spray.
HOW CAN ELECTROSTATIC SPRAY HOW YOUR BUSINESS?
If your business is home to large rooms that are highly-susceptible to germs and bacteria—such as research and development facilities, locker rooms, etc.— then an electrostatic spray disinfectant is the perfect solution to ensure each and every crevice is cleaned and safe.
Electrostatic cleaners simplify cleaning surfaces plagued by germs and bacteria. This technology is an innovative way to fight infections, viruses, and other fast-spreading and harmful things that lurk around us. 
For commercial cleaning assistance, get in touch with the electrostatic disinfectant specialists at The Heiser Group.

markdown:
# The Cleaning Benefits of Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray

## The Cleaning Benefits of Electrostatic Disinfectant Spray

Fighting every type of bacteria and germ requires constant change and the latest and greatest innovations in cleaning technology. As of now, that means the use of electrostatic disinfectants and cordless, handheld sprayers that unleash its disinfecting prowess wherever needed.

With new tech comes new questions. Learning everything about electrostatic disinfectant cleaners and why this new advancement is such an effective tool is the key to maintaining a healthy _and productive_ office environment.

## WHAT EXACTLY DOES “ELECTROSTATIC” MEAN?

The classic, tried-and-true style of disinfecting usually means a rag and some sprays but—unless you are constantly cleaning your supplies—that usually just ends up spreading the germs and bacteria around.

With electrostatic disinfectants, you’re using a specialized solution—combined with air and [atomized by an electrode inside the sprayer.](https://www.cmmonline.com/articles/q-a-electrostatic-spray-technology) Thanks to the combination of the solution and sprayer, [the spray contains positively charged particles](https://commercialcleaningcorp.com/what-is-electrostatic-disinfection-and-how-does-it-work/) that are able to stick to and coat any surfaces and objects. This provides better coverage of large surfaces and a strong disinfectant solution.

## WHY IT IS AN EFFECTIVE CLEANING SOLUTION

Electrostatic spray is—as the name suggests—electrically charged. This means that the appropriate sanitizers and disinfectants can fully wrap surfaces and completely clean them. No area is left untouched. Normal cleaners like sprays, wipes, and rags will spread germs around and it is easy to miss spots within, on top, or behind surfaces—where bacteria hides.

It is an efficient way to clean, also. [Surfaces that are already covered will repel the spray](https://commercialcleaningcorp.com/what-is-electrostatic-disinfection-and-how-does-it-work/).

## HOW CAN ELECTROSTATIC SPRAY HOW YOUR BUSINESS?

If your business is home to large rooms that are highly-susceptible to germs and bacteria—such as research and development facilities, locker rooms, etc.— then an electrostatic spray disinfectant is the perfect solution to ensure each and every crevice is cleaned and safe.

Electrostatic cleaners simplify cleaning surfaces plagued by germs and bacteria. This technology is an innovative way to [fight infections, viruses](https://www.cleanlink.com/sm/article/Electrostatic-Cleaning-An-Asset-To-Infection-Control--21966), and other fast-spreading and harmful things that lurk around us.

For commercial cleaning assistance, [**get in touch with the electrostatic disinfectant specialists at The Heiser Group.**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact)

What areas do you serve in the Chicagoland area?

Is professional carpet cleaning effective?
Yes, professional carpet cleaning is highly effective in removing dirt, stains and odors from your carpets. Through specialized techniques and a professional strength formula, carpet cleaning can improve the air quality in your home by eliminating allergens and bacteria that may be trapped in the carpet fibers.
Is professional carpet cleaning better than doing it yourself?
While a DIY mixture of warm water and cleaner may seem like a cost-effective option, professional carpet cleaning offers several advantages. Professional carpet cleaners have access to powerful equipment and specialized cleaning solutions that can effectively remove deep-seated dirt, stubborn stains and unpleasant odors. Professionals are also trained in proper carpet cleaning techniques, ensuring a thorough and efficient job.
DIY carpet cleaning often involves renting or purchasing less powerful machines that may not provide the same level of cleanliness. When using a new cleaning solution or unique blend, it is recommended to test it on an inconspicuous area for color fastness. Using incorrect cleaning solutions can lead to damage to your carpets or ineffective results.
Professional carpet cleaning also saves you time and effort. Cleaning your carpets yourself can be a time-consuming task, especially if you have a large area to cover.
What is the best kind of professional carpet cleaning?
The best kind of professional carpet cleaning is one that combines powerful cleaning machines, skilled technicians and specially formulated cleaning solutions without synthetic fragrances. This ensures a thorough and deep clean, removing dirt, stains, bacteria and odors from your carpets. The Heiser Group takes pride in providing top-quality carpet cleaning services that are both effective and safe.
‍
How long does the carpet take to dry after professional shampooing?
The drying time for carpets after professional shampooing can vary depending on various factors, such as humidity, ventilation, soil and carpet thickness. On average, carpets typically take around 4–6 hours to dry completely.
‍
What do professionals use to clean carpets?
Professionals use a combination of powerful carpet cleaning machines and specially formulated cleaning solutions. These machines work by injecting hot water and cleaning solution into the carpet fibers, agitating them to loosen dirt and stains. The machines then extract the dirty water, leaving your carpets fresh and clean. Professionals may also use a spot treatment for a tough stain, such as a pet stain, and high-powered extraction tools for thorough rinsing.

Is professional carpet cleaning effective?

Professionals use a combination of powerful carpet cleaning machines and specially formulated cleaning solutions. These machines work by injecting hot water and cleaning solution into the carpet fibers, agitating them to loosen dirt and stains. metadata.title: How to Be Environmentally Friendly When Cleaning Your Office
metadata.description: Consistent office cleaning is a great habit that results in better health and increased productivity but using the wrong products can have the opposite effect. Here are some simple tips to help you and your office to be environmentally friendly when cleaning your office.

text:
How to Be Environmentally Friendly When Cleaning Your Office
How to Be Environmentally Friendly When Cleaning Your Office
Consistent office cleaning is a great habit that results in better health and increased productivity but using the wrong products can have the opposite effect.
Here are some simple tips to help you and your office to be environmentally friendly when cleaning your office.
Use Eco-Friendly Cleaning Products
The first step to going green with your office cleaning is choosing the best, most eco-friendly cleaning products.
When looking for environmentally friendly products, the Environmental Working Group (EWG) the EWG Guide to Healthy Cleaning is generally a smart place to start and see if the products you’re using are safe and healthy for both you and the environment. Each product is given a grade from A-F that represents how it affects human and environmental health in its daily usage and production.
Following their guidelines, it’s important to pick products that not only use safe, non-toxic chemicals, but also won’t harm the environment when disposed of.
Use Non-Toxic Chemicals When Cleaning
Most of your day-to-day, well-known cleaners make use of very toxic chemicals because they’re cheaper and/or easier to produce. The products that the EWG recommends consumers to buy in their place were created using safer ingredients, such as vinegar and other natural oils.
In general, chemicals to watch out for when cleaning your standard workspace include:
Carcinogens
Endocrine Disruptors
Neurotoxins
Ammonia and Chlorine Bleach
While there are more to watch out for, but these are some of the most common ones you’ll find in store-bought cleaners.
Safe Chemical Disposal
Whether you’ve just finished cleaning or are disposing of your old, harmful chemicals, make sure you do it in ways that won’t harm the environment around you.
Generally, there are two quick steps you can take:
READ THE LABEL
Most products will provide a toll-free number to call that will give you accurate information on how to properly dispose of that product or its container. Some will simply be thrown away, whereas others must be taken to certain facilities or recycled in specialized ways.
DILUTE WITH WATER
If a product mixes with water, dilute it with running water and dispose of it down the drain. This greatly reduces the overall impact of the cleaning agent.
Use Natural Air Cleaners
You may not even think about what you’re doing to your office’s air when looking to freshen it up. Simple things like a stinky spill or somebody’s lingering lunch lead many to reach for that Air Wick and spray it everywhere.
But think twice about that. The quality of your office’s air is extremely important and using poor products can have negative health benefits.
According to the EWG’s Guide to Healthy Cleaning, Air Wick (and many other air fresheners) have wholeheartedly earned an “F” grade when it comes to environmental friendliness. This rating takes into consideration the chemicals in the product, its effect on the environment, its sustainability in production, and any negative health effects.
Instead, look to use great, sustainable products that work hard to earn an A grade. This makes for better quality air in the office which has many health benefits like decreasing the risk of illness and increasing comfort and productivity in your workforce.
Using natural cleaners will result in the same clean office that more harmful products deliver, but with the added benefit of creating a healthier environment, both in the environment and within your workforce.
While these tips will give a head start to any office employee when it comes to promoting an eco-friendly environment, sometimes you need more of a heavy duty approach. When that time comes, call in the experts at The Heiser Group.
‍

## Use Non-Toxic Chemicals When Cleaning

Most of your day-to-day, well-known cleaners [make use of very toxic chemicals](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.groovygreen.com%2F5-tips-for-eco-friendly-office-cleaning%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2Z_EyATRKoDjR4jSv5m97QaT2906ncL2wRovwW3JC1-5Qtu3kKTajmjKY&h=AT1Nlj4puCqWd6qieN92vSBhTQso4dqPwFZ6QYmurfwWeGqhH3P0lkFRLDYAj6RkHNtjzP8aOVHG6_8QnTImm1wdR6pUVf4xwclJ2Ix-iAiltpa9IB-yes-pKKbUkzPSc58HxQ) because they’re cheaper and/or easier to produce. In general, [chemicals to watch out for](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ewg.org%2Fhealthyhomeguide%2Fcleaners-and-air-fresheners%2F%3Fgclid%3DCj0KCQjw2K3rBRDiARIsAOFSW_52bEEFDWkC_J5BNzfG1_Dfm6Y9PBJt60J7Y4x6Xhbl_xzDyWu3bV0aAtcqEALw_wcB%26fbclid%3DIwAR0vfFDWiZ2U9_mdugC40heFZVAxPsXXpEz2n7hM6xAqEMzaMGljrvxO4lQ&h=AT0CXPm-fTH7UmXncUaxVDCz2y9Byjsv05np9hmErYIYelw8BTYjjqLgBV5jK2K_YD9G9XyMrondbPJV6PORARx8RVuBpl3k94mSFcPA22ncmpljquQ7Vu7CxJ_tK8hvfvU4Ww) when cleaning your standard workspace include:

### **READ THE LABEL**

Most products [will provide a toll-free number](https://earth911.com/inspire/programs-initiatives/safely-dispose-cleaning-products/?fbclid=IwAR1ZUlOAJPr5yRa_2m_s1V3CZB8TJRru5-SzTbEwWjNoqH5Mvm4uKj3oato) to call that will give you accurate information on how to properly dispose of that product or its container. [Some will simply be thrown away](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fearth911.com%2Fearth-watch%2Fcheat-sheet-biodegradable%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2jUt634y1lN6Imcg-zl4SHuvROdDiU7nOoGNdjgbL7OBEixCFdb-cK5Vw&h=AT1q9EWjfGps8D3mZd7xtPtdz7aJA2_T-5T3l7TlchyBmho8N4nTJUxKAoeVVSs56ttT1mPszzO1yBVV3vHpU3b5QPDxxXbbfa_sXslYM4Xe6EYbge2uXtMpa-i-TUURmMN8cA), whereas others must be taken to certain facilities or recycled in specialized ways.

### **DILUTE WITH WATER**

If a product mixes with water, dilute it with running water and dispose of it down the drain. This greatly reduces the overall impact of the cleaning agent.

## Use Natural Air Cleaners

You may not even think about what you’re doing to your office’s air when looking to freshen it up. Simple things like a stinky spill or somebody’s lingering lunch lead many to reach for that Air Wick and spray it everywhere.

But think twice about that. [The quality of your office’s air is extremely important](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.epa.gov%2Findoor-air-quality-iaq%2Foffice-building-occupants-guide-indoor-air-quality%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR1EeKWYp4Q2Zd2SdhEfkeFkzlI2Lnm8yFqCv-bl2IlzkjLJfLGzVaO3rww&h=AT23oiXOTH-t9DE6zHPddh0XnERr6B8QmPAW-mGvvoeuo5zw_YIbCQwO-XMELGeb-skuxXRwppAj_N4PrWNoRJ4QTu1boyF8t6uzo6lXXMLxx0zwE3jp_u3qI7tI5QjQjFIC8w) and using poor products can have negative health benefits.

According to the EWG’s Guide to Healthy Cleaning, [Air Wick](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ewg.org%2Fguides%2Fcategories%2F1-AirFresheners%3Fgrade%3Df%26fbclid%3DIwAR208uotjGjAd6CLniX_Yt4CcdvNZT-TiCcHB2ZKjAYkgV5KZrvNb7CLUVQ&h=AT1lH2cI-m9GdVFOzeL8LG0g_dCAvOizQswPEW_Mn_66SexTobaiIMAv3ycwese7r3Uv_gIM1IqY63KKo1KsPoV9zeYnVYN1uf8mSZskU5I4PdOhjK5y8q9_kUbfHt-HxI_8Ag) (and many other air fresheners) have wholeheartedly earned an “F” grade when it comes to environmental friendliness. This rating takes into consideration the chemicals in the product, its effect on the environment, its sustainability in production, and any negative health effects.

Instead, look to use [great, sustainable products](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ewg.org%2Fguides%2Fcategories%2F1-AirFresheners%3Fgrade%3Da%26fbclid%3DIwAR3gwR3onHkrCntZiuTcYVockMbt_5f_7Bv7VR5P6pYKF_FXDHfHIH2UAgI&h=AT2z_M92riBxfF2AwUR74ORg4_p-yL1i-WbwLpxTedc__Rz-uOX8qVGoyNpdfmxmkFEQ9OBpNPFtiCDUF9O_4BtUZD7LAAAsTRleQCCXIFghrbSqc1lLdFdOPt1114dzfMFvfQ) that work hard to earn an A grade. This makes for better quality air in the office which has many health benefits like [decreasing the risk of illness and increasing comfort and productivity in your workforce.](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.epa.gov%2Findoor-air-quality-iaq%2Foffice-building-occupants-guide-indoor-air-quality%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3RHkRQv7zJk2qGJjNtrzCspcaFYtU35c7u1PFU2rcJ_28kqmDcRNyvkFw%23why-indoor&h=AT284A5gPoYrIGpM1acUsjGIxy6HiN0XsuOBEEv_rRIJT9Gq-iENYkaifN_XjHe1etvxRC1pygTCNeCBhbCkpXYEs-Lp-oI4rUmNLJa_cFCmWb2ChMqt1qT7UL01XfTGCIGmBQ)

Using natural cleaners will result in the same clean office that more harmful products deliver, but with the added benefit of creating a healthier environment, both in the environment and within your workforce.

While these tips will give a head start to any office employee when it comes to promoting an eco-friendly environment, sometimes you need more of a heavy duty approach. When that time comes, call in the experts at [**The Heiser Group**](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fheisergroup.com%2Fcontact-us%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2e_fL24bVGvWTd1I2rN_gVZQosSof30ErfsN_jc4pTPrEKN8ym9XLhgco&h=AT1vh2IFRvL6m4x221ZrKsqN5WsLGQvGao00gKcdcLDrv6a8BPWfonK8XAh8S0Ia9fLXrU5GpVNsMxmlKJzDsBa7bojLiztS8gnony6gQI9_Eny1RFQpWvo_aDI-xvTO3Zs8oQ).

text:
Residential Cleaning
No Mess.
Less Stress.
"Good enough" is not an option for us! For a professional cleaning service in Chicagoland that gets the job done right, contact The Heiser Group today.
Residential Cleaning FAQ's
What areas do you serve in the Chicagoland area?
We serve the all of the Chicagoland area, providing professional cleaning services to homeowners and renters alike. Whether you live in the heart of downtown or the surrounding suburbs, we are here to cater to your cleaning needs. With our local presence and expertise, you can trust that we understand the unique cleaning requirements of the Chicagoland area. Sit back, relax, and let us take care of your cleaning needs, leaving your home clean, fresh, and inviting.
‍
Is professional carpet cleaning effective?
Yes, professional carpet cleaning is highly effective in removing dirt, stains and odors from your carpets. Through specialized techniques and a professional strength formula, carpet cleaning can improve the air quality in your home by eliminating allergens and bacteria that may be trapped in the carpet fibers.
What is the difference between carpet cleaning and upholstery cleaning?
Carpet cleaning refers to cleaning carpet, while upholstery cleaning refers to cleaning fabric of furniture.
Should I hire a professional carpet cleaner?
Hiring a professional carpet cleaner is highly recommended if you want to ensure the best possible results and extend the lifespan of your carpets. With our expertise and specialized equipment, we can tackle even the toughest stains and dirt, leaving your carpets looking fresh and rejuvenated.
Is professional carpet cleaning better than doing it yourself?
While a DIY mixture of warm water and cleaner may seem like a cost-effective option, professional carpet cleaning offers several advantages. Professional carpet cleaners have access to powerful equipment and specialized cleaning solutions that can effectively remove deep-seated dirt, stubborn stains and unpleasant odors. Professionals are also trained in proper carpet cleaning techniques, ensuring a thorough and efficient job.
DIY carpet cleaning often involves renting or purchasing less powerful machines that may not provide the same level of cleanliness. When using a new cleaning solution or unique blend, it is recommended to test it on an inconspicuous area for color fastness. Using incorrect cleaning solutions can lead to damage to your carpets or ineffective results.
Professional carpet cleaning also saves you time and effort. Cleaning your carpets yourself can be a time-consuming task, especially if you have a large area to cover.
What is the best kind of professional carpet cleaning?
The best kind of professional carpet cleaning is one that combines powerful cleaning machines, skilled technicians and specially formulated cleaning solutions without synthetic fragrances. This ensures a thorough and deep clean, removing dirt, stains, bacteria and odors from your carpets. The Heiser Group takes pride in providing top-quality carpet cleaning services that are both effective and safe.
‍
How long does the carpet take to dry after professional shampooing?
The drying time for carpets after professional shampooing can vary depending on various factors, such as humidity, ventilation, soil and carpet thickness. On average, carpets typically take around 4–6 hours to dry completely.
‍
Is professional carpet shampooing safe for pets and children?
Yes, professional carpet shampooing is safe for pets and children when done by a reputable company like The Heiser Group. To avoid any slips or falls, it is recommended to keep pets and children away from freshly cleaned carpets until they have dried completely.
‍
What do professionals use to clean carpets?
Professionals use a combination of powerful carpet cleaning machines and specially formulated cleaning solutions. These machines work by injecting hot water and cleaning solution into the carpet fibers, agitating them to loosen dirt and stains. The machines then extract the dirty water, leaving your carpets fresh and clean. Professionals may also use a spot treatment for a tough stain, such as a pet stain, and high-powered extraction tools for thorough rinsing.
‍
Still have questions?
Contact The Heiser Group today!

text:
5 Tips to Keep a Clean and Healthy Office Environment
5 Tips to Keep a Clean and Healthy Office Environment
In the workplace, we are all constantly looking for ways to increase productivity and promote a healthy environment for employees, clients, and business partners. As they say: cleanliness is next to godliness.
A clean work environment helps you stay organized, work efficiently, and provides a healthy place where you and your coworkers can feel comfortable every day. In fact, a clean workplace can result in a 2-8% increase in productivity.
For help with achieving better productivity, The Heiser Group has 5 tips to help you keep a clean and healthy office environment:
1. Disinfect Everyday
In the workplace, germs build up quickly thanks to many shared tools and surfaces, along with the trading of papers and supplies between many people. This makes it extremely easy for one sick person to pass along germs and quickly lead to a room full of sick people.
Things like refrigerator doors, microwaves, vending machines, copiers, prints, water fountains, staplers and other office supplies, and the many surfaces in the bathroom are the most common places where germs are spread.
Besides constantly washing your hands with soap and water, an easy, quick remedy is to disinfect consistently by keeping a bottle of basic hand sanitizer at your desk. In addition, a container of disinfectant wipes will let you quickly clean hard surfaces, along with anything else you touch in the office.
2. Clean Your Carpets and Floors Regularly
With the many small office supplies (like staples and paper clips) moving around, the floor tends to be the place with the most debris buildup. If you prefer to eat your lunch or snacks at your desk, then this is especially true for the crumbs and spills that call the floor under your desk, “home”.
For carpets, there are a multitude of different cleaning strategiesdepending on what the stain or mess you’re trying to clean up. When it comes to basic crumbs and fallen litter, keeping a small vacuum around your desk will do the trick. For stains or lingering smells from uncleaned messes of the past, a small spot cleaner may be the way to go. To maintain fresh carpet upkeep, do both of these things regularly.
On the other hand, vacuuming can work just as well with hard floors, such as wood and tile. Depending on the type of floor you have, different chemicals and cleaning techniqueswill work to disinfect, clean, and brighten up a workspace.
If the job exists beyond the realm of just your desk, it may be time to look into professional help.
3. Minimize Clutter
The best way to keep a well-maintained desktop is to minimize the clutter from desk decorations, gadgets, and paper.
While a touch of personality from decorations and small toys is a great way to liven up your workspace, too much can make it difficult to clean dust build-up and misplaced supplies.
4. Go Digital
Going fully digital with your files and documents is a great way to reduce clutter, reduce your imprint on the environment, and create a stress-free work environment for both your colleagues and yourself. Start scanning important documents to keep on your computer, work through word processors like Google Docsand Microsoft Word, and rely on apps like PandaDoc to keep track of your most important documents.
If paperless is not an option, look into the different organizers to maintain a physical inbox system for your desk, while keeping the majority of your desktop as clear as possible.
5. Schedule a Time for Cleaning
The easiest way to develop a habit is by doing it consistently and continuously. In order to get the most out of your workspace, schedule a block of time every day, every week, or every month, exclusively dedicated to tidying up. And it doesn’t have to be boring, use different incentives and methods like rewards for the cleanliest workspace, cleaning competitions, or make your dedicated deep-cleaning day an office-wide event.
In order to make this day successful, make it as easy as possible for the office to clean their spaces by providing many waste bins throughout, have an abundance of available cleaning supplies, and thoroughly communicate to the team that it is time to clean.
GO WITH THE PROFESSIONALS
Sometimes you need to call on the experts. If a job gets out of the scope of routine cleaning, go with the pros at The Heiser Group and let us give you the clean, stress-free work environment you need to keep your company at your best.
To take the first step towards a sparkling clean office environment, send us a message at HeiserGroup.com.
‍
markdown:
# 5 Tips to Keep a Clean and Healthy Office Environment

## 5 Tips to Keep a Clean and Healthy Office Environment

In the workplace, we are all constantly looking for ways to increase productivity and promote a healthy environment for employees, clients, and business partners. As they say: cleanliness is next to godliness.

A clean work environment [helps you stay organized, work efficiently, and provides a healthy place](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.monster.com%2Fcareer-advice%2Farticle%2Fhr-involved-clean-office-0109%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2BXMntYn4NaaTUP4ut4dlq3Ul7YQfEf1bAPHxDl9eF4I0AfQv53ZYcyiI&h=AT2jxDRK5HUjNzGAwpDztKV9I-iEUrGY-8McUSDfPC7oZ3DKFkMz9W0PVAcA4dIxS_ltn0bdR7MxRc20zwZ36WHTF6Hv5rw7tFn6vh-e-z_18MxxMQIlC9KzsxpyRe0wgaU7Vg) where you and [your coworkers can feel comfortable](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbescleaning.com%2F2017%2F10%2F06%2Fclean-workspace-promotes-productivity%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2V_WR1tDO-CxycJQWfZKCtVulb4pP5Lu0rt39Bejd936TMQB7JjMj3L2g&h=AT1u49myZX0T-uShI6Drox35W_w5uF215nqE12zcTrLYD-CPrY9VcO_aGqm8sauf-EOA2uL5nVimAoFyESoF2uB4wQwHPFV3BhKHxrvRzqwCcndA9Q5xDsYPVO3VY4Qk6WIquw) every day. In fact, a clean workplace [can result in a 2-8% increase in productivity](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cleanfreak.com%2Fblog%2Fwhy-is-a-clean-office-important%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3TizEyqG6QyuX2Dfe0hyegX-wwzMSTTdRFqMirT5er1bt5-KTa7nF3lbU&h=AT0x4MqQLZzJg8MIPLzilo7z7JSGxO3je6dnEw3R0XC8mFZWyd4AkOgKROgncA4dM5GZ3XmRmcrny--JexHm-15NByhzMI2W0khxB0TiyVArZOTaGorHelqJoYGbLQ1xUPrmKg).

For help with achieving better productivity, The Heiser Group has 5 tips to help you keep a clean and healthy office environment:

## 1\. Disinfect Everyday

In the workplace, germs build up quickly thanks to many shared tools and surfaces, along with the trading of papers and supplies between many people. This makes it extremely easy for one sick person to pass along germs and quickly lead to a room full of sick people.

Things like refrigerator doors, microwaves, vending machines, copiers, prints, water fountains, staplers and other office supplies, and the many surfaces in the bathroom are the most common places where germs are spread.

Besides constantly washing your hands with soap and water, an easy, quick remedy is to [disinfect consistently](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.quill.com%2Fblog%2Ftutorials%2Fhow-to-disinfect-your-office-space-during-flu-season.html%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR1ud-HTpo7C7jaGEYgRxCEYo6UMHpGJPqXEd-153_P-S71mOvajYbou0gM&h=AT062iCUQ3OCy9mDMUD-CTSWGn3V-vv39eQ9hKkyG84E_fvb6ykuh9c5VKNOhDXOMFUwDVjBwY-Ye-p3jUPKpdI23jqMJIlCrm3QEQ0HfTLEZXBwm_iKE4uLefEJ7xlqlbf_UQ) by [keeping a bottle of basic hand sanitizer at your desk](https://www.cdc.gov/handwashing/show-me-the-science-hand-sanitizer.html?fbclid=IwAR14q6c8JOAQhlG0JlIXDg0aaWqzfD0XcoXNVc3JHsDs1hn6MF1pvs96xkY). In addition, a container of disinfectant wipes will let you quickly clean hard surfaces, along with anything else you touch in the office.

## 2\. Clean Your Carpets and Floors Regularly

With the many small office supplies (like staples and paper clips) moving around, the floor tends to be the place with the most debris buildup. If you prefer to eat your lunch or snacks at your desk, then this is especially true for the crumbs and spills that call the floor under your desk, “home”.

For **carpets**, there are [a multitude of different cleaning strategies](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.realsimple.com%2Fhome-organizing%2Fcleaning%2Fcleaning-stain-removal%2Feasy-carpet-stain-solutions%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3YRG244N32RiT21t4Gz8gSG0OuRzyxLUrBGxa8ur8OZI7EpOkDMm9n3nw&h=AT1s_uvsHjPSshU0r1CscouzSOb68BmFE7AsNfna4Sc1QzJ7sNxewmGADF2Xi2n2kZDQkce48vH1WcASOJ8xFWtPbu6QL0Mw_-yeB17cPj0EYqDP9Iw6r-_kp3km9D_sN_00fw)depending on what the stain or mess you’re trying to clean up. When it comes to basic crumbs and fallen litter, keeping a small vacuum around your desk will do the trick. For stains or lingering smells from uncleaned messes of the past, a small spot cleaner may be the way to go. To maintain fresh carpet upkeep, do both of these things regularly.

On the other hand, vacuuming can work just as well with **hard floors**, such as wood and tile. Depending on the type of floor you have, [different chemicals and cleaning techniques](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.realsimple.com%2Fhome-organizing%2Fcleaning%2Ftricks-to-clean-any-type-of-floor%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR16S9K0HXcQv9Xj1toJtOrDjaEtKcxjbCHRuAdpcMVUDFo3I1EBdobKls8&h=AT1I2POvxmno_pJeqa71amVtYn6wuL71qxZYYzI0VlE7wy3dDkaYnN8_4xMcuht6KLwRGK3t5OUnCzosM7LcmJTYEgdh-Xvk6XeT_bcniw7VD2f1EJM4jUZ_Zj9dTi4PKy6gGg)will work to disinfect, clean, and brighten up a workspace.

If the job exists beyond the realm of just your desk, it may be time to look into professional help.

## 3\. Minimize Clutter

The best way to keep a well-maintained desktop is to [minimize the clutter from desk](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.becomingminimalist.com%2Fhow-to-keep-your-desk-clear%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3V7IKG-BXcJKFyFpuUTWM2iENZ6co3E5Fzrj2AszuU8DSHpShlijp9e-s&h=AT09p0DYhF39Ma0mHP3cuuv9U43guWIz98sNBkpAEqvj8UyDTFche1eU2P-0QL0s_E02JPBL2zaGSMC3H_HV5s8nq9S0M65PXUqnOfp4ATInWqCDXD9tPPMR3zfRme9-xlukXg) decorations, gadgets, and paper.

While a touch of personality from decorations and small toys is a great way to liven up your workspace, too much can make it difficult to clean dust build-up and misplaced supplies.

## 4\. Go Digital

Going fully digital with your files and documents is a great way to reduce clutter, reduce your imprint on the environment, and [create a stress-free work environment](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fopenworksweb.com%2F10-ways-a-clean-office-improves-productivity%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2HsTiyqBIjlBfcbH023r76hb9rM1ogq7m74i-hOPqMoexpS4xWJzlh9qE&h=AT0hXArhjgbuQdTCeihgvP3RnLLYnxDpenr08j4OUMOkPl4aBBRtDHwJF7WVmhyaB04u0snDgz7G9SU9i0iHzs84WWEuXF2252l9Eu2MMtNfZFKJL52Fo5SHB7esiEPOIxsAKw) for both your colleagues and yourself. Start scanning important documents to keep on your computer, work through word processors like [Google Docs](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR0lz7G7Zak6LpH4vLJUHHXPelqwAn7x4Iu0UToZVMC77oglX-6csWu9id4&h=AT1x6DLSy1r7dNz3YrJQm-NUlllJnkVl_mVl4eSWDCAdvCKvIK5PLCiTNXA76gqn4EuYZoaW2gYX6z_njLQVbYcoNLBXD4kDhgNJQAXb_5t0pXd3WMm_-5lASNGSmRvFGBypKQ)and [Microsoft Word](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fproducts.office.com%2Fen-us%2Fword%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3RQTGVgNUDuEHStdi6vxi4bobcmoPdNPmgxlQDnAmuUgXBMLMMLb-WkrI&h=AT1bw7Ae0O5Mk2D0b7hQpPTo1yYLduTEk1fB8IXAMCK6IkjpmzQU15e3DS8uZSi-kFsujBFkImO3vk7gA6BY0ZPNLMcuINGUZhrH8OgvFRU9008mrQM0NCr2Tza7ug2a18ax0g), and rely on apps like [PandaDoc](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pandadoc.com%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR1Q8VQDkN0SZRI_lWyVTIRkXcdxrSn3RMnUoCjrXLshDzqdQS_5h-or-Ss&h=AT1GP53d87E6q2CRN5tEEGGJTwtuCASCdQ_XlClaXlb50H2_Cd2RPjbLSWjjGEyIbnEp6rOwXm75GP6aC9-RQXDRaZ-6Jr15bmuLJoIbGV_KX-qUIrJvs7Vb4Vuv2K8WuxGlEA) to keep track of your most important documents.

If paperless is not an option, look into the different organizers to maintain a physical inbox system for your desk, while keeping the majority of your desktop as clear as possible.

## 5\. Schedule a Time for Cleaning

The easiest way to develop a habit is by doing it consistently and continuously. In order to get the most out of your workspace, [schedule a block of time every day, every week, or every month, exclusively dedicated to tidying up](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.monster.com%2Fcareer-advice%2Farticle%2Fhr-involved-clean-office-0109%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3usWUsqUL6kLdCjIoyqfXuQYSXnsJKniisxaCZniOUv9Zzuo-WNP3Uic8&h=AT0hTQfweOgfWbuB3AeAzZxtk6SXlcHEoxI3WZaC-_nVavlSG1s7XD1ra1V8d8fIdMTP7B7_yFWBmztGPJcv5XR1zRgFCROcFjL3e25DZBm5vO8H0lls49HF9WUUAYrLiJaGVQ). And it doesn’t have to be boring, [use different incentives and methods](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.staples.com%2Fcontent-hub%2Forganization%2Fcleaning%2Fhow-to-make-office-cleaning-a-companywide-habit%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2sldEAWe5d0DJPbh13Sxa_57zsLC6sOtsSdqJ7tSaxPCpacajbr877CWw&h=AT0goz-zQ4siD4veURc2ZIOjgOx9Pp4fFh5IWnNX3vsi4Jm_l1kFSJRboUP8YhOB1B4Q7ar4jVuwqYvmzHMdfx-qVaKYXHaNxcxKkULuJ6pyffUymzYUQri9_n3YiWYT8g7uow) like rewards for the cleanliest workspace, cleaning competitions, or make your dedicated deep-cleaning day an office-wide event.

In order to make this day successful, make it as easy as possible for the office to clean their spaces by providing many waste bins throughout, have an abundance of available cleaning supplies, and thoroughly communicate to the team that it is time to clean.

### GO WITH THE PROFESSIONALS

Sometimes you need to call on the experts. If a job gets out of the scope of routine cleaning, go with the pros at The Heiser Group and let us give you the clean, stress-free work environment you need to keep your company at your best.

To take the first step towards a sparkling clean office environment, send us a message at [**HeiserGroup.com**](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fheisergroup.com%2Fcontact-us%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR0l5P0jTVFq6GOljuch3_gvctgQuro2-uitIiWZ7gNfDwvD6PZMU95ZaHA&h=AT0_49JUnuihqTtS56Bo-jtpagyja-MypLn-sjc1Q-OdIGOaChv8r3Dn4p5C8hX-GgBMLcmVCsY-iRNw3IKHg08PqAtyM7U4PFmr3eIhy6_YK51T1OMDkC1WqoCilQYnUE5dsIBqxP6rM65ASFM).

metadata.title: How to Pick an Industrial Floor Cleaning Provider
metadata.description: If you own or help to manage an office space or a factory, you might want to consider outsourcing your floor cleaning to an industrial services provider. An industrial cleaner will be able to wash, rinse, and polish your floors much more quickly and thoroughly than a one-man crew or an intern with a mop.Moreover, qualified and professional industrial cleaners will have the expertise and tools necessary to ensure that they’ll leave your floors as clean as the day your business opened.It’s easy to see why you’d want to hire an industrial floor cleaner, but where can you find a great provider of industrial floor cleaning services? When doing your research for a new commercial cleaning company that can make a good partner, there are two primary qualities to look for.

text:
How to Pick an Industrial Floor Cleaning Provider
How to Pick an Industrial Floor Cleaning Provider
If you own or help to manage an office space or a factory, you might want to consider outsourcing your floor cleaning to an industrial services provider. An industrial cleaner will be able to wash, rinse, and polish your floors much more quickly and thoroughly than a one-man crew or an intern with a mop.
Moreover, qualified and professional industrial cleaners will have the expertise and tools necessary to ensure that they’ll leave your floors as clean as the day your business opened.
It’s easy to see why you’d want to hire an industrial floor cleaner, but where can you find a great provider of industrial floor cleaning services? When doing your research for a new commercial cleaning company that can make a good partner, there are two primary qualities to look for.
INTERNET PRESENCE
In 2019, a professional, friendly internet presence is no longer optional. An experienced industrial cleaning company is highly likely to have some sort of internet presence, be it on Google, Facebook, or another platform entirely.
Check out these pages for reviews and to see how the business responds to customer inquiries and comments. You’ll want to choose an industrial floor cleaning provider who addresses feedback, has a history of excellent reviews, and conducts business in a professional manner.
Not only that, but this type of consumer feedback can offer insight into the pros and cons of partnering up with them.
Are they on time for appointments?
Do they offer power washing?
Is the process convenient, yet thorough?
RECEPTIVENESS
Another good sign for your next industrial floor cleaning partner is their receptiveness to customer questions. To ensure you’re conducting your due diligence, don’t be afraid to inquire into their methodology.
Just a few items worth asking about include:
Which cleaning solutions the provider uses
Which chemicals those solutions rely upon
What sort of machinery the provider uses
How much time the provider will need to dedicate to ensure a thorough cleaning
Make sure whatever answers you receive meet your organization’s needs and that your questions are answered politely and promptly. If not, continue your search for another commercial cleaning company.
Now that you know where and how to look for qualified industrial floor cleaners, take the initiative to hire one of these valuable service providers! You’ll love having cleaner floors and your employees will be thankful for the better-looking workspace.
To leave your floors looking immaculate, send us a message at HeiserGroup.com.

# How to Pick an Industrial Floor Cleaning Provider

## How to Pick an Industrial Floor Cleaning Provider

If you own or help to manage an office space or a factory, you might want to consider outsourcing your floor cleaning to an industrial services provider. An industrial cleaner will be able to wash, rinse, and polish your floors much more quickly and thoroughly than a one-man crew or an intern with a mop.

Moreover, qualified and professional industrial cleaners will have the expertise and tools necessary to ensure that they’ll leave your floors as clean as the day your business opened.

It’s easy to see why you’d want to hire an industrial floor cleaner, but where can you find a great provider of industrial floor cleaning services? When doing your research for a new commercial cleaning company that can make a good partner, there are two primary qualities to look for.

### INTERNET PRESENCE

In 2019, a professional, friendly internet presence is no longer optional. An experienced industrial cleaning company is highly likely to have some sort of internet presence, be it on [Google](https://goo.gl/maps/aaQfJdBjksFGqzSH7), [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/theheisergroup/reviews/), or another platform entirely.

Check out these pages for reviews and to see how the business responds to customer inquiries and comments. You’ll want to choose an industrial floor cleaning provider who addresses feedback, has a history of excellent reviews, and conducts business in a professional manner.

Not only that, but this type of consumer feedback can offer insight into the pros and cons of partnering up with them.

1.  Are they on time for appointments?
2.  Do they offer power washing?
3.  Is the process convenient, yet thorough?

### RECEPTIVENESS

Another good sign for your next industrial floor cleaning partner is their receptiveness to customer questions. To ensure you’re conducting your due diligence, don’t be afraid to inquire into their methodology.

Just a few items worth asking about include:

*   Which cleaning solutions the provider uses
*   Which chemicals those solutions rely upon
*   What sort of machinery the provider uses
*   How much time the provider will need to dedicate to ensure a thorough cleaning

Make sure whatever answers you receive meet your organization’s needs and that your questions are answered politely and promptly. If not, continue your search for another commercial cleaning company.

Now that you know where and how to look for qualified industrial floor cleaners, take the initiative to hire one of these valuable service providers! You’ll love having cleaner floors and your employees will be thankful for the better-looking workspace.

To leave your floors looking immaculate, send us a message at [**HeiserGroup.com**](https://www.heisergroup.com/contact).
